title: Systemingenjör till sektionen Land Capability Development
description:
*Vill du påverka och göra skillnad på riktigt? Här bidrar du till att skapa trygghet för människor och samhällen. Det du gör spelar roll.*


Din roll


Du kommer bli en del av sektionen Land Cabability Development som har innovation i fokus. Uppgiften att se framåt och jobba med ny teknik och nya tankesätt för att kunna möta våra användares närstående och framtida behov av verksamhetsnära IT-stöd för landdomänen (dvs datorkomponenter, mjukvaror, sensorer och kommunikationslösningar som tillsammans bygger ett ledningsstödsystem).


Sektionen är ny och söker flertalet medarbetare med lite olika kompetensprofiler för att bygga upp teamet och den verksamheten teamet ska utföra. Vi kommer tillsamman jobba med innovation genom bland annat studier, prov och försöksverksamhet, demonstrationer, forskningsprojekt, samarbetsprojekt och speciella utvecklingsprojekt. Både på egen hand och i nära samarbete med andra sektioner och enheter på Saab, med kunder och användare och med partners och leverantörer.


Huvudsakliga uppgifter för sektionen är:

* Testa och utvärdera ny teknik och produkter och nya sätt att använda befintlig teknik och produkter
* Tekniska utredningar och systemarbete för att hitta krav och design för kommande system samt svara på möjligheter och begränsningar med olika typer av systemlösningar
* Upprätthålla demonstrationsförmåga av olika system och genomföra demonstrationer
* Driva initiativ för innovation genom nya tekniska idéer, nya metoder eller annat nytänkt som kan ge systemen hög förmåga snabbt och komplettera eller utöka dagens systemförmågor
* Utveckla prototyper, nya systemförmågor eller hela systemlösningar i tidiga tekniska faser
* Bistå med teknisk kompetens för projekteringar inför kommande affärer och utveckling av nya affärer
* Stödja långsiktigt partnerskap och internationellt samarbete inom Landdomänen


Du kommer att ingå i vår Business Unit Digital Battlespace Solutions och arbeta med avancerade C4I-lösningar (Command, Control, Communication, and Computer Information Systems). Vår verksamhet fokuserar på att digitalisera den markbaserade domänen och leverera säkra och integrerade IT-lösningar för våra kunder. Vi arbetar med Military-off-the-shelf (MOTS) hårdvara och mjukvarupaket och våra lösningar används av ledande förband på alla nivåer, från grupp till högkvarter.


Din profil


Vi söker dig som är nyfiken, initiativtagande och driven lagspelare med en entreprenörsanda och god kommunikationsförmåga. Du är klurig och tänker gärna utanför boxen och du är lika gärna med och utvecklar, utreder samt att vara i labb för att testa nya lösningar.


Du bör ha en teknisk bakgrund. En examen som civilingenjör eller motsvarande är önskvärd om än inte nödvändig. Annan teknisk utbildning eller bakgrund kan vara lika lämplig så som teknikfokuserad militär utbildning eller annan relevant arbetslivserfarenhet eller utbildning.


Vi är intresserade av att arbeta med kandidater med olika typer av erfarenhet. Vi ser att du kan komma direkt från Universitet eller ha en längre erfarenhet. Vilket som bjuder tjänsten på variation och utvecklingsmöjligheter.


Vi söker dig med någon eller några av nedanstående kunskaper och kompetenser:

* Integration av system, dvs sammansättning och konfiguration av olika tekniska produkter bestående av både mjukvaror (användarapplikationer, säkerhetsmjukvaror, operativsystem mm) nätverk och hårdvaror (datorer och mobila enheter, switchar, routers, krypton, sensorer, extern kommunikationsutrustning eller annan extern utrustning)
* Test och utprovning av system och produkter, både i labbmiljö men även hos användare
* System engineering med krav och design i fokus
* Kommunikationssystem, både kommersiella (mobila/5G, satellit…) och militära (radio) med tillhörande mjukvarusystem
* Mjukvaruutveckling


Det är även meriterande med erfarenhet av:

* Cloud
* AI
* Användbarhet/UX
* Cybersäkerhet


Det är oavsett bakgrund meriterande om du har kunskap om militära ledningsstödssystem eller en förståelse om militär verksamhet och utmaningar.


Språk: Vårt dagliga arbete kräver att du talar och skriver obehindrat på både svenska och engelska


Resor: Resor kommer att förekomma i tjänsten, både till andra Saabenheter men även till kunder och partners. Körkort (B) är starkt meriterande.


Placeringsort: Uppsala eller Järfälla


Befattningen kräver att du genomgår och godkänns enligt vid var tid gällande bestämmelser för säkerhetsskydd. För befattningar där Saab har krav på säkerhetsklassinplacering kan, i förekommande fall, medföra krav på visst medborgarskap.


Vi växer så det knakar, och hos oss finns stora möjligheter för dig att utvecklas – oavsett om du vill fördjupa din expertis eller utforska nya områden. Ta chansen att bli en del av vårt team och bidra till teknik i framkant!


Vad du blir en del av


Upptäck oändliga möjligheter. Anta utmaningar, skapa smarta innovationer och uppgradera dina förmågor. Det här är en plats för kluriga tänkare, modiga pionjärer och alla däremellan. Tillsammans uppnår vi det extraordinära, var och en tar med sitt unika perspektiv. Varje bidrag räknas.


Saab är ett ledande försvars- och säkerhetsföretag med uppdrag att hjälpa nationer att skydda sin befolkning och bidrar till trygghet för människor och samhällen. Med 26,100 talangfulla medarbetare utvecklar Saab teknik och lösningar för en säkrare och mer hållbar värld.


Saab utvecklar, tillverkar och underhåller avancerade system inom flygteknik, vapen, ledningssystem, sensorer och undervattenssystem. Saab har sitt huvudkontor i Sverige men en global verksamhet där Saab är en del av många nationers försvarsförmåga. Läs mer om oss här


Vänligen observera att vi arbetar med löpande urval och tjänsten kan komma att tillsättas innan sista ansökningsdatum har gått ut.
company_description: Saab serves the global market with world-leading products, services and solutions from military defense to civil security.

title: Platform Architect
description:
##### **Create Your Better Tomorrow**


With over 50 years of experience in the industry, Kollmorgen, a Regal Rexnord brand, is a technology leader in navigation and fleet control of automated guided vehicles (AGVs) and autonomous mobile robots (AMRs). In our continued effort to innovate and grow, we are now expanding and are seeking talents to join us and be part of our success story.


Our definition of success goes beyond customer satisfaction; it includes fostering the talent of tomorrow. At Kollmorgen, we cultivate a collaborative and inclusive environment where innovation thrives and every individual is valued. Our commitment to professional growth and development ensures that you will have the opportunity to advance your career while working on cutting-edge automation solutions.





##### **We are looking for a Platform Architect to be part of a dynamic team that is passionate about making a difference in the world of AGVs and AMRs.**

##### **Position Overview**


As a Platform Architect, you will be part of our Engineering department, along with the other 70+ engineers working within embedded systems, system software as well as windows applications and web services. You will work in the Engineering team, reporting directly to the Director of Engineering and working alongside the Lead Solution Architect and other system architects situated in other teams.


In this position, you play a central role in defining and evolving the architectural vision for our entire product portfolio. You will guide and support system architects embedded in our development teams, ensuring alignment across solutions and technologies. This is a strategic leadership role where your experience and insight will help shape the architectural runway for our future growth in the AGV and AMR market.

##### **What does success look like in this position:**

* **Architectural Vision & Impact:** Successfully defines and evolves a scalable, cohesive platform architecture that aligns with business strategy and enables long term growth and innovation.
* **Mentorship & Portfolio Cohesion:** Effectively guides and empowers system architects across teams, fostering architectural consistency and future-proof design across the product platform.
* **Strategic Decision Making:** Makes architectural choices that drive product evolution, unlock innovation, and deliver sustained customer values.
* **Cross-functional Integration:** Builds strong partnerships with engineering, UX, product management, and data teams to ensure seamless integration and architectural integrity across all initiatives.
* **Technology Leadership:** Proactively identifies and adopts emerging technologies that enhance platform performance, flexibility, and cost-efficiency.
* **Governance & Standards Excellence:** Ensures adherence to enterprise architecture standards and governance practices, promoting reliability, maintainability, and alignment across all solutions.

##### **To achieve the mission and success of this position, we believe you already have:**

* Educational background in Computer science, IT, Engineering, or equivalent;
* Proven experience in a senior architectural role, ideally guiding architecture across multiple teams or product lines.
* At least 5 years of experience working with solution architecture, system design, or software engineering;
* Deep understanding of architectural principles, design patterns, and modern software development practices;
* Experience working in Scrum/SAFe environments and leading technical initiatives.
* Ability to communicate complex technical concepts clearly to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
* Fluency in English, both spoken and written;
* Strong collaboration and communication skills;
* Ability to anticipate, address, and solve complex problems;
* Drive to challenge the status quo to create breakthrough innovations;
* Flexibility and adaptability in changing circumstances.

##### **We find it beneficial if you have:**

* Familiarity with cloud platforms, microservices, APIs, and integration strategies;
* Experience working with AGV and AMR, or warehouse automation and intralogistics systems.
* Proven experience in risk assessment and designing products that align with regulatory frameworks, for example secure-by-design methodologies and isolation through separation of concerns.


We see that our ideal candidates are committed to personal & professional growth, and they share our core values and genuine enthusiasm for innovation.


##### **Additional Information**


Full time employment | Based in Mölndal, Sweden

  

Selection takes place on an ongoing basis, so be sure to apply early. We're excited to hear from you!


Please submit your application in English.

##### **Kollmorgen - Autonomous Mobile Solutions**


We offer a complete automation solution for AGV and AMR providers. Our NDC Solutions platform is a proven platform that enables efficient and reliable vehicle automation with increased performance. It includes all hardware, software, and navigation technologies necessary to automate a vehicle fleet. The platform has been installed in a vast variety of material handling sites and vehicles across the globe.

title: Senior UX Manager
description:
**Bring more to life.**


Are you ready to accelerate your potential and make a real difference within life sciences, diagnostics and biotechnology?


At Cytiva, one of Danaher’s 15+ operating companies, our work saves lives—and we’re all united by a shared commitment to innovate for tangible impact.


You’ll thrive in a culture of belonging where you and your unique viewpoint matter. And by harnessing Danaher’s system of continuous improvement, you help turn ideas into impact – innovating at the speed of life.


Working at Cytiva means being at the forefront of providing new solutions to transform human health. Our incredible customers undertake life-saving activities ranging from fundamental biological research to developing innovative vaccines, new medicines, and cell and gene therapies.


At Cytiva you will be able to continuously improve yourself and us – working on challenges that truly matter with people that care for each other, our customers, and their patients. Take your next step to an altogether life-changing career.


Learn about the Danaher Business System which makes everything possible.


We are looking for an experienced and driven **Senior Manager, User Experience (UX) Design** to join our global user experience team and lead product software user experience design for stand-alone and integrated software across Cytiva’s biotechnology portfolio. In this role, you will foster a collaborative, creative and continuous improvement culture within the design team and with stakeholders in product management, R&D and product marketing.


This position reports to the Director, User Experience Design, is part of the global user experience team and will be located onsite in Uppsala, Sweden.

**What you will do:**

* Lead, mentor, and manage a team of UX designers and UI designers to deliver user-centered design solutions for our product software portfolio.
* Support the product development process by driving the UX strategy and vision for assigned products aligning with overall business goals
* Champion a user-centered design approach across the organization and influence product decisions with compelling narratives grounded in user insights
* Own the development, evolution and and implemention of Cytiva´s Software Design system.
* Set ambitious goals for the team, drive operational efficiency, provide developmental feedback to support individual growth, manage resources and support the budget process
* Foster a culture of creativity, collaboration, and continuous improvement within the design team.
* Strong problem-solving, collaboration, communication, and interpersonal skills, including the ability to influence and work effectively in cross-functional teams.

**Who you are:**

* Bachelor’s degree in User Experience Design, Human-Computer Interaction, or related field.
* Proven experience in user experience design in software applications, with a proven track record of delivering innovative and user-centric solutions.
* Previous experience leading a UX design team either as a people leader or project manager.
* Strong understanding of design and usability principles, including best practices.
* Experience with design tools such as Adobe Creative Suite, Figma, Sketch, InVision.

**It would be a plus if you also possess previous experience in:**

* Master’s degree in UX design, human computer interaction or related field
* UX design experience in Healthcare or Life Sciences field and or experience in designing SW integrated with instrumentation


Cytiva, a Danaher operating company, offers a broad array of comprehensive, competitive benefit programs that add value to our lives. Whether it’s a health care program or paid time off, our programs contribute to life beyond the job. Check out our benefits at Danaher Benefits Info.


Join our winning team today. Together, we’ll accelerate the real-life impact of tomorrow’s science and technology. We partner with customers across the globe to help them solve their most complex challenges, architecting solutions that bring the power of science to life.


For more information, visit www.danaher.com.
company_description: Cytiva is a global provider of technologies and services that advance and accelerate the development and manufacture of therapeutics, addressing urgent needs and helping save patient lives.

title: UX-Designer sökes
description:
**Brinner du för användarens upplevelse, och vill bidra till att bygga ett smartare och mer robust samhälle? Sök rollen som UX-Designer på Combitech i Växjö!**

**Vad vi erbjuder**
-------------------


På Combitech satsar vi på våra medarbetare, de utgör kärnan, hjärnan och hjärtat i vår verksamhet. Det gör vi till exempel genom att satsa på din kompetensutveckling, göra det lätt för dig att kombinera jobbet med vardagen och andra schysta förmåner. Dessutom står vi på en stadig grund av högteknologi, forskning och anställningstrygghet med försvars- och säkerhetskoncernen Saab som ägare.


Vi erbjuder en roll i ett långsiktigt och expansivt uppdrag som har en lång historia på Combitech. Du blir en del av en organisation som idag sysselsätter ca 40 personer och som kännetecknas av ett nära samarbete och ett flexibelt och agilt arbetssätt. Här ges möjlighet till flexibla arbetstider, kontinuerlig kompetensutveckling och utrymme för eget ansvar.

**Vad rollen innebär**
----------------------


I rollen som UX-designer verkar du för att användarens upplevelse blir den bästa möjliga för de produkter som utvecklas. Du tar fram skisser och prototyper för nya och befintliga produkter tillsammans med produktägare, kravställare och användare. Du ansvarar för att ta fram riktlinjer för våra olika produkters gränssnitt och har en kontinuerlig dialog kring UX och användargränssnitt med våra utvecklingsteam.


Som UX-designer arbetar du nära våra produktägare och utvecklingsteam. Användarupplevelsen kommer att vara ditt fokus för både nya och äldre produkter.

**Vad vi söker**
----------------


Vi söker dig som brinner för att förstå användarens behov och omsätta dessa till enkla och tydliga gränssnitt. Att ta ansvar, se till helheten och att vara den centrala punkten kring UX-arbetet är naturligt för dig. Som person tror vi att du är en kommunikativ och ödmjuk lagspelare som gillar att dela med dig av dina kunskaper. Du har en god teknisk förståelse, gillar kreativitet samt har en känsla för färg och form.


Slutligen letar vi efter dig som har flera års erfarenhet som UX designer och har jobbat brett inom UX med både research och design. Vi tror att du har en relevant universitets eller högskoleutbildning inom området och behärskar svenska i tal och skrift.

 **Då tjänsten innebär arbete som omfattas av försvarssekretess krävs det att du genomför och godkänns i en säkerhetsprövning med registerkontroll.**

**Urval sker löpande. Vi ser fram emot din ansökan!**


Kontaktperson/rekryterande chef: rebecka.falk@combitech.com

title: UX Design Lead
description:
Requisition ID: 23152
Job Category: Information Technology
Career level: Specialist
Contract type: Permanent
Location:
Gothenburg, SE  

SKF’s Digital Product Design team is looking for a UX Lead who enjoys the challenges of designing enterprise solutions at scale. You should have experience leading and driving design consensus with your fellow designers, product teams and product management across a portfolio of applications with a strong focus on user centricity, collaboration and using design to enable business objectives.

  


 If you enjoy connecting the problem to the solution and get satisfaction of working strategically as well as doing the hands-on-work, this role is for you!

  



**UX Design Lead**

  




You will join an established design team made up of UX leads, UX designers, UI designers, as well as service designers. We work with customers, users, sales, product development and product management and together deliver global solutions. Our team is part of SKF’s Digital Engineering Innovation organization where we play a crucial role in developing the digital landscape of SKF.

  


  

**Key Responsibilities**



* To drive the overall user experience and alignment of the software within your area of responsibility to meet user needs and business goals
* Collaborate and facilitate discussions across product design, product development, and product management to achieve alignment and consensus on decisions
* To empower designers in your team with clarity, scope, and direction
* To be the voice of the design team and the user during strategic and planning discussions
* To push the importance of design, design thinking and having a user centred approach to software development and product management
* To shape and deliver on Digital Product Design team’s strategy and way of working alongside other designers


**Your profile**


* At least 5 year’s professional experience working as a designer
* Experience leading other designers
* University degree within a design, creative field, or human behaviour related field
* Demonstrated abilities to drive discussions, workshops and have critical thinking to meet business goals
* Experience working within enterprise solutions within large to mid-sized organisations
* Proficient in English and Swedish

  



**You will enjoy working here if**  

You like to work in an innovative environment with focus on high speed in delivery. You are a team player that is driven by the interaction of team members as well as stakeholders. You have high integrity and the ability to build relationships with people on all kind of levels in different organizations. You are self-motivated, have strong drive and an action-oriented mind-set with high sense of personal accountability. You have a willingness to learn and support others to learn.  

  

**We offer you**



* A job in an international environment
* To be part of a Design Team that is fostering and growing design as a discipline at SKF
* To be part of driving digital transformation within SKF and accelerating change
* To be a part of a diverse team where you face exciting challenges and varied tasks

  


*SKF is committed to creating a diverse environment, and we firmly believe that a diverse workforce is essential for our continued success. Therefore, we only focus on your experience, skills, and potential.* *Come as you are – just be yourself. #weareSKF*

  




**Additional Information**  

  

Location: Hybrid work environment. Office located in Gothenburg.
  

  

The position reports to Global Design Manager – Digital Product Design. For questions regarding the recruitment process, please Anna Barkin Johansson via Anna.Barkin.Johansson@skf.com, Recruitment Expert. Note that we can’t accept applications via email.

  


**Is this you?**  

If the answer is yes, submit your CV in English no later than 5th of October.

  


*At SKF, we are committed to promoting fairness and inclusivity throughout our recruitment process. To achieve this, we may include assessments and verify the information in your application in compliance with country-specific laws and regulations. If you have any questions regarding this, please contact the Recruitment Expert.*

title: Thesis Work - Empowering Sustainable Decision-Making: A Dynamic UX Interface for Business Case Analysis Application
description:
**Company Description**  

To enable the fossil freedom that drives society forward – this is our purpose. We are looking for talented students who want to help us on our journey towards fossil freedom. By writing a thesis at Vattenfall, you will have a unique opportunity to contribute to our purpose.

 **Job Description** **About the Thesis Work**

* The Industry Decarbonisation team at Vattenfall R&D is accelerating the transition from fossil fuels to electrified solutions through groundbreaking technology and partnerships. One successful project from us is HYBRIT: a collaboration between Vattenfall, SSAB, and LKAB, which has enabled fossil-free steel production by replacing coal with fossil-free hydrogen.
* As part of Vattenfall’s strategic initiatives towards fossil freedom, we run advanced value chain simulations to evaluate the economic benefits of various energy and industry transition projects. We are offering a thesis opportunity to design and evaluate a UX (User Experience) interface for our internal business case analysis application that enhances the usability of the application, making complex business case results easily understandable and actionable for various stakeholders within the organisation, such as business analysts, project managers, and external partners. The UX interface should aim to streamline the decision-making process by presenting the simulation outcomes in a clear and intuitive manner. The interface should be dynamic, allowing users to engage more deeply with the business case results, interact with the data, customise views, and explore different scenarios, giving the user an understanding of and providing guidance on the implications of each decision, facilitating a comprehensive understanding of the contributions associated with each stage of the value chain.

**Goal/Purpose**

* The thesis will involve researching best practices in dynamic UX design, with the opportunity to conduct user interviews and usability tests to gather feedback on interactive features, and iteratively refining the interface based on user input. The ultimate goal is to develop a user-centric and dynamic design that improves the accessibility of information and facilitates informed decision-making regarding energy and industry transition projects.


This assignment is for 2 students.

 **Qualifications** **Your Profile**


We are looking for a student or students who want to work towards fossil freedom and who are about to graduate from their academic studies. You are also someone who identifies with our principles: Active, Open, Positive, and Safety.

* Education – User Experience Design, Human-Computer Interaction, Information Technology, Industrial Design, or a similar discipline.
* Scope – 30 credits per student.
* Fluent in English, fluency in Swedish would be meritorious.

  

**Additional Information**  

* Start date: 2026-01-26 or by agreement.
* Location: Solna, Stockholm.
* Application – one file containing your letter of motivation, CV and a copy of your transcripts.
* Application deadline: 2025-10-26.
* Contact person and supervisor at Vattenfall: Matilda Carlsson, matilda.carlsson@vattenfall.com

**Diversity and Inclusion – In Everything We Do**


We are convinced that heterogeneous teams can outperform homogeneous ones. But we can only unlock the power of diversity when everyone feels included. Read more about our important work on diversity and inclusion at https://careers.vattenfall.com/se/sv/jobba-med-oss/mangfald-inkludering.

**About Vattenfall**


At Vattenfall, we are determined to enable fossil freedom. To succeed, we must first become fully fossil-free ourselves as one of Europe’s largest energy companies. But that is not enough. To contribute to a fossil-free society, we need to do more than just focus on sustainable energy production.


We believe that enabling fossil freedom requires us to address the challenge from a broader perspective than merely producing energy sustainably.


Join us on the journey towards fossil freedom.


As Vattenfall is part of Sweden’s critical infrastructure, many of our roles are security-classified. This means that, if this position is security-classified, final candidates may be subject to a special security clearance in accordance with the Security Protection Act.

title: Musti Group – UX/UI Designer
description:
**About Musti Group**
 Musti makes the life of pets and their owners easier, safer and more fun. We are the leading Nordic pet care company and we operate an omnichannel business model to cater for the needs of pets and their owners across Finland, Sweden, Norway and the Baltics. We offer a wide, curated assortment of pet products. We also provide pet care services such as grooming, training and veterinary services in selected locations.
   

  

 Musti Group’s net sales were EUR 444 million in 2024. We have over 2,000 employees, 1,9 million customers and 415 stores.
   

  

*Read more about us!*
**We are now looking for a new talent to join us as**
**UX/UI Designer for our Digital team at Musti Group**
 Musti Group is in an interesting phase of renewing our whole digital ecosystem to better support further expansion. At our eCommerce and customer domain we are transforming both the platform and the team to be more growth-oriented and to work better towards our business objectives without compromising the quality of our technical platforms.
   

  

 As our UX/UI designer you will be responsible for shaping every step of the customer journey across all of our eCommerce shops, including purchase experience, services, knowledge articles and much more. You’ll spend your time designing user-friendly interfaces, prototypes and developing our design system together with our senior UX/UI designer. You will also work closely together with our developers, scrum master and product owners to ensure that our future eCommerce has both business value and technical excellence.
   

  

**What You Will Do**
* Design user-friendly, intuitive interfaces for our 6 eCommerce shops that help us drive growth online
* Contribute and drive user research and turn insights into wireframes and prototypes
* Work closely with our senior UX/UI designer, Frontend Lead developer and other developers to bring your designs into life


**Who You Are**
* 3+ years of working experience as UX/UI designer, preferably within e-commerce or digital products
* Solid skills in Figma (or similar tools) and working with design systems (e.g. storybook)
* Experience in conducting A/B tests and interpreting results
* Experience in working with developers and as part of agile teams
* Experience in conducting user research such as interviews, questionnaires and focus groups
* Experience in facilitating workshops and discussions with internal stakeholders


**What We Consider As a Plus**
* Working experience within retail brands
* Working experience with multi-brand, international companies
* Familiarity with HTML/CSS to understand basics of translating design to code
* Knowledge of accessibility standards (WCAG) and designing for inclusivity
* Swedish or Finnish skills


**Why join our pack?**
 We offer you diverse and inspiring work in the rapidly growing and evolving business of one of the leading pet retail companies. UX/UI Design is a vital part of Musti Group’s future online success, and our different brands will truly offer you a challenge to develop in your work.
   

  

 We believe in fostering a culture of continuous improvement and innovation, giving you the freedom and responsibility to do your work. We have flexible working hours and a flexible remote work policy to support you in your work, as well as well-being and other local benefits.
   

  

 For this position, your main location can be Helsinki or Stockholm. Please note that for this position we cannot offer relocation. We often have dogs in the office; therefore, the work might not be suitable for a person who is allergic to pets.
   

  

**Next steps**
 If you have any questions, please contact Tiina Korvenoja tiina.korvenoja[at]mustigroup.com
   

  

 Please submit your CV and application
 **in English** 
 by
 **22nd September** 
 at the latest. Please also note that we cannot offer relocation package for this role. We will contact all applicants at the latest one week after the application period closes but may start interviews already earlier.
   

  

 Arken Zoo grundades 1987 och är Sveriges största detaljhandelskedja för husdjursprodukter, med ca 115 butiker runt om I landet. Sedan 2015 ingår Arken Zoo i Musti Group, med totalt nästan 250 butiker i Norden.
   

  

 Genom våra fysiska butiker, veterinärkliniker, hundfrisörsalonger och e-handel erbjuder vi ett brett och prisvärt sortiment med produkter och tjänster av högsta kvalitet för ditt husdjur.
   

  

 Viktigare än vår storlek är vår vision om att göra livet enklare, säkrare och roligare – för husdjur, hussar och mattar.
   

  

 Välkommen till Arken Zoo. Vi älskar djur. Djur älskar oss.

title: Product Designer (App UI Focus, 12 Month Contract)
description:
10% of Europe's CO₂ emissions are caused by residential heating, and energy bills are out of control. Aira is here to change that.
   

  

 With our intelligent Aira Heat Pump at the heart, we're making the switch to clean energy-tech easier and more affordable. Helping Europe turn off gas and slashing energy costs one home at a time.
   

  

 Founded in 2022, and with 1000+ employees and counting, Aira is driving the clean energy revolution by providing homes with modern clean energy-tech solutions such as solar power, battery storage solutions, and heat pumps. With a state-of-the-art production facility in Poland, an HQ in Stockholm, Sweden, and hubs across the UK, Germany, and Italy, Aira is well on track to install clean energy-tech into 5 million homes by 2034.
   

  

**About The Role**
 We are now looking for a talented mid-level Product Designer to join our team in Stockholm for a substitute period of 9–12 months with a main focus on designing our mobile application, ensuring beautiful, consistent, and highly usable experiences that help customers engage with their energy systems. Our customer-facing app isn’t just another digital product, it directly operates our intelligent Aira Heat Pump, and will soon integrate with solar, EV charging, and battery solutions. This is a unique opportunity to design digital experiences that connect users with real, life-changing energy technology in their homes.
   

  

 In this role, you will:
   

  

  

* Design responsive, user-centered interfaces following UX/UI best practices and accessibility standards.
* Build wireframes, prototypes, and high-fidelity designs that clearly communicate user flows and interactions.
* Contribute to our design system by building scalable components, and style guides that ensure consistency and quality across projects.
* Support and conduct usability and prototype testing, applying insights to improve the customer experience.
* Design and refine both new features and existing app experiences, bringing variety and continuous improvement.
* Collaborate closely with developers to ensure accurate implementation and smooth handoffs.


**What You Bring To The Team**
* 5+ years of professional experience as a Product Designer, with strong focus on UI and app design.
* A portfolio showcasing pixel-perfect, user-centered design work on mobile or web apps.
* Proficiency in Figma and prototyping tools.
* Strong understanding of usability, accessibility, and responsive design.
* Experience in design systems and component management.
* A proactive, collaborative mindset with the ability to adapt quickly.
* Fluency in English (spoken and written).


**Nice to Have:**
* Experience working in agile teams.
* Experience designing complex digital products, with the ability to grasp technical aspects and translate them into intuitive, user-friendly interfaces


**What is in it for you?**
* Gain hands-on experience in a fast-growing scale-up, with a supportive and inclusive culture, and career advancement opportunities.
* Collaborate with diverse teams across international markets and launch products globally.
* Develop and grow personally and professionally in an entrepreneurial-minded environment.
* Thrive in a dynamic, solution-oriented culture, tackling challenges and driving meaningful solutions that make a positive impact on the world.
* Influence the company's success, with a visible impact on product development and market growth.
* Enjoy the flexibility of our hybrid work model and discover our brand-new office at Norra Stationsgatan 93 in Stockholm. Conveniently located near public transport, with Sankt Eriksplan and Odenplan stations just a few minutes' walk away


 At Aira, we champion the next-generation energy as well as diversity and inclusion. We firmly believe that a diverse workforce fosters innovation and creativity, enhancing our ability to serve customers and communities effectively. We welcome individuals from all backgrounds, cultures, and perspectives to join our team. Our commitment is to uphold equality and inclusivity, fostering a collaborative environment where everyone can thrive and contribute to a better future for our people and the planet.

title: Product Marketing B2C
description:
**Job Description**
* Location: Fully remote, EU timezone (CET +/- 2hours)
* Start date: ASAP
* Languages: English is mandatory; French is a plus
* Our client: Cloud Computing / Distributed Systems / AI - European Saas


 We are hiring at Pragmatike to expand our team and drive the growth of our internal projects.
   

  

 Our focus is on developing cutting-edge solutions in Cloud Computing, Blockchain, and Artificial Intelligence, while fostering a culture of collaboration and innovation. Joining us means being part of a passionate team where your ideas and skills directly contribute to shaping tomorrow's technologies.
   

  

 If you're excited about working on ambitious projects in a dynamic and flexible environment, we'd love to hear from you!
   

  

**Objectives of this Role:**
* Enhance Hives product marketing content output including written, video, graphic and infographic for B2C and C2B markets.
* Develop and implement product marketing campaigns that resonate with existing customers.
* Ensure all product marketing materials align with Hives brand values and sustainability mission.
* Foster strong relationships with internal teams and key stakeholders to drive product marketing initiatives and product roadmaps.
* Monitor product marketing budgets and optimize spend to achieve the highest return on investment (ROI).
* Increase user engagement and retention through strategic communication efforts.


**Responsibilities:**
* Lead the development and execution of product marketing content tailored to our current user base.
* Create and manage comprehensive product marketing timelines, ensuring timely deployment.
* Educate and collaborate with other departments to maintain consistent product messaging across all channels.
* Oversee the teams product marketing campaigns, ensuring alignment with company goals and user needs.
* Shape and articulate Hives product storytelling vision and voice for our B2C offerings.
* Negotiate and manage budgets to support large-scale product marketing initiatives.


**Skills and Qualifications:**
* Exceptional written and verbal communication skills
* Video/ reel, graphic and infographic production capabilities (with fluency in relevant AI toolings when necessary) would be highly preferred
* Extensive experience in product marketing and development, particularly in the B2C software/ cloud/ technology space.
* In-depth knowledge of market trends and product lifecycle management.
* Proven ability to develop and execute strategic product marketing campaigns.
* High degree of empathy, with the ability to understand and address user needs and concerns.
* Strong negotiation skills and the ability to manage budgets effectively.


**Preferred Qualifications:**
* Demonstrated leadership capabilities and experience in guiding cross-functional teams.
* Ability to intuitively assign responsibilities and manage team dynamics.
* Significant experience in designing and executing customer promotions.
* Familiarity with web development languages and technologies (HTML, CSS, JavaScript) is a plus.
* Proficiency in product design, UX/UI techniques and a solid understanding of software engineering or computer science principles.


**Pragmatike** 
 is dedicated to a fair, transparent, and inclusive recruitment process. We ensure that no applicant is discriminated against based on age, disability, gender, gender identity or expression, marital or civil partner status, pregnancy or maternity, race, religion or belief, sex, or sexual orientation.
   

  

 In accordance with the General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR), your personal data will be processed lawfully, fairly, and securely. We collect and use your personal data solely for recruitment purposes, including sharing it with our client(s) for employment consideration. You have the right to request access, correction, or deletion of your data at any time. We are committed to maintaining the confidentiality and security of your information throughout the recruitment process.

title: Head of UX Design
description:
At Hive Streaming, we enable the world’s largest enterprises to use live video as a strategic tool for communication, alignment, and impact. Trusted by more than 130 global customers, Hive combines market-leading video distribution technology with unique communication analytics, helping organizations ensure flawless video experiences and measure how effectively messages reach, engage, and align employees.
   

  

 Our users are IT and Network professionals who rely on Hive every day to ensure flawless video delivery, Event Producers who ensure optimal video experience during internal company events, Leaders and Communications professionals who plan and execute powerful video-enabled strategies to deliver measurable impact.
   

  

**About The Team**
 As Head of UX Design, you are part of Hive’s Product organization, reporting to the CPO, and lead the UX Design team. You represent the UX Design craft in the Product Development Leadership trio, next to the CPO and CTO.
   

  

 Your mission is to shape and drive execution of a clear user experience vision that ensures our products are customer-centric, intuitive, and impactful. You will influence our product portfolio evolution, co-creating remarkable solutions, coaching a high-performing UX Design team and creating a culture of experimentation and continuous learning.
   

  

**About The Role**
* You define and champion a clear user experience vision for the Hive product portfolio based on customer outcomes, in alignment to Hive’s product strategy.
* You lead the UX Design team to deliver on a long-term vision and continuously advance the UX Design craft in the company. You spearhead design initiatives with strategic impact and UX Design ops workstreams.
* You lead by example through hands-on design contributions when needed, supporting and elevating the team’s work by applying your craft directly, demonstrating best practices, and acting as a force multiplier for design quality.
* You help advance customer-centric, outcome-driven continuous discovery & delivery practices as a member of the Product Development Leadership trio.
* You collaborate across functions, inspire your peers and company management to enable remarkable UX solutions you’ve helped co-create.
* You grow and mentor the UX Design team, fostering psychological safety, growth, and continuous feedback.
* You lead and structure the UX Design function for resilient, ongoing impact delivery. You work with your peers to anticipate where the business, industry, and UX design practice are going and evolve the UX vision and team structure accordingly.


 Who we are looking for
   

  

 We're Looking For Someone With a Strong UX Design Foundation In B2B Enterprise Products - But Just As Importantly, The Right Attitude. At Hive, How You Work Is Just As Valuable As What You Know. We Are Looking For Someone With The Following
   

  

* 5+ years’ experience in Product Design, with a strong foundation as an individual contributor and people leadership experience as a direct lead, mentor, coach.
* Experience setting up and scaling UX Design practices in fast-moving, complex product environments.
* Strong expertise across product design and user research, especially for B2B software, data-heavy, enterprise-grade applications.


**And Just As Importantly, We Believe You Are**
* A humble, empowering leader who lives and elevates Hive’s values of innovation, customer centricity, and empowerment, enabling the team to do their best work.
* An excellent communicator and facilitator with a growth mindset, who embraces change with curiosity, ownership and grit.
* A believer in continuous improvement of products, processes, and yourself.


**Location**
 Stockholm, Sweden (Hybrid: 2-3 days/week in the office)
   

  

*🐶Just a heads up, we're a dog-friendly office!*
**What Hive Offers**
* A mission-driven culture where UX Design has continuous strategic influence.
* The opportunity to shape a growing product portfolio used by key roles in enterprises to drive impact through video.
* A lean, customer-centric product development culture, enabling fast decisions through empowerment.
* A diverse, collaborative team that values curiosity, rapid learning, and new perspectives.
* Hybrid work model: Based in our Stockholm office, with 2–3 days a week on-site for collaboration and creativity.
* Great benefits: Wellness stipend, pension, health insurance, extra vacation days, benefit bikes, and more!


 Recruitment process: what to expect
   

  

 To apply, please submit your CV, portfolio, and answer a few short questions in lieu of a cover letter directly in the application form. Please submit all documents in English.
   

  

 Our hiring process is designed to be transparent and collaborative:
   

  

* Intro call: Meet our People & Talent Partner and share more about your motivation
* Hiring manager interview: Meet our CPO, discuss your UX Design leadership journey
* Case interview: Collaborate with the UX Design team on a practical challenge
* Leadership interview: Meet our Chief People Experience Officer and peers in the leadership team, to align on values and vision
* Reference checks: We take security seriously, and conduct 2 reference checks to stay compliant with internal protocols and regulatory requirements
* Decision: Timely feedback and next steps


 Depending on your availability, we expect the process to be completed within 3-4 weeks.

title: Data Scientist
description:
**Hej, Truecaller is calling you from Stockholm, Sweden! Ready to pick up?**
 Our goal is to make communication smarter, safer, and more efficient, while building trust across the world. With our roots in Sweden and a global reach, we deliver smart services that create meaningful social impact. We are committed to protecting you from fraud, harassment, scam calls, and unwanted messages, so you can focus on the conversations that matter.
   

  

* Top 20 most downloaded apps globally, and the world’s #1 caller ID and spam-blocking service for Android and iOS, with extensive AI capabilities, with more than 450 million active users per month.
* Founded in 2009, listed on Nasdaq OMX Stockholm, and is categorized as a Large Cap. Our focus on innovation, operational excellence, sustainable growth, and collaboration has resulted in consistently high profitability and strong EBITDA margins.
* A team of 400 people from ~35 different nationalities spread across our headquarters in Stockholm and offices in Bangalore, Mumbai, Gurgaon, and Tel Aviv, with high ambitions.


**We at the Search Team** 
 are responsible for Spam Detection, AI Identity, Name Resolution, and Fraud Detection. By accurately assigning names to phone numbers, detecting spam and fraud, and providing contextual caller information, we enhance users' trust and safety, empowering them to make informed decisions about incoming calls and directly supporting Truecaller’s mission of enabling safe and trusted communication.
   

  

**As a Data Scientist within the Search team** 
 , you’ll lead high-impact initiatives that directly shape user experiences across core features, including Caller ID, Spam & Fraud Protection, and Name Resolution. Your work will drive innovation in spam detection, name accuracy, and large-scale experimentation. Ideal for someone who excels at the crossroads of data science, product, and engineering, leveraging ML, stats, and data engineering to solve meaningful, real-world problems.
   

  

**The Impact You Will Create**
* Exploring the problem space and finding data science solutions that provide step increases in customer experience.
* Planning data science work for the team, with an emphasis on collaboration to achieve common goals.
* Lead efforts to detect and prevent spam, ensuring user safety and platform trust.
* Drive the development and optimization of name election algorithms to improve identity accuracy.
* Design and run large-scale experiments to improve user experience and feature performance.
* Collaborate cross-functionally with product, engineering, and analytics teams to implement data-driven solutions.
* Translate complex data insights into clear strategies and actions.


**What You Bring In**
* Bachelor's or Master's degree in Data Science, Machine Learning, Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Physics, or a related field.
* 2+ years of experience in using data science and machine learning to solve real-world problems
* A track record of leading data science projects in a team, collaborating in planning, coding, and communication
* Excellent programming skills in Python and SQL
* Solid understanding and experience with the tooling for Python - IDEs, unit testing frameworks, and static code checks
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to present complex data and insights to non-technical stakeholders
* Strong problem-solving skills and a results-oriented mindset
* Customer obsession
* Able to own and drive projects and products to production and iteratively improve them over time


**It Would Be Great If You Also Have**
* Understanding how to query very large data efficiently (we use BigQuery)
* Experience with data from mobile applications
* Experience with data visualization and reporting tools, such as Tableau, Looker, or Power BI (we use Looker)
* Solid understanding of engineering requirements necessary to put machine learning solutions into production and scale them to hundreds of millions of customers


**Life at Truecaller -** 
 Behind the code:
 **https://www.instagram.com/lifeattruecaller/**
**Sounds like your dream job?**
 We will fill the position as soon as we find the right candidate, so please send your application as soon as possible. As part of the recruitment process, we will conduct a background check.
   

  

**This position is based in Stockholm, Sweden.**
 We only accept applications
 **in English** 
 .
   

  

**What We Offer**
* A smart, talented, and agile team: An international team where ~35 nationalities are working together in several locations and time zones with a learning, sharing, and fun environment.
* A great compensation package: Competitive salary, 30 days of paid vacation, flexible working hours, private health insurance, parental leave top-up, pension contribution, Udemy membership to keep learning and improving, and free gym membership.
* Great tech tools: Pick the computer and phone you fancy most within our budget range.
* Office life: We strongly believe in in-person collaboration and follow an office-first approach while offering some flexibility. Enjoy your days with great colleagues with loads of good stuff to learn from, and a wide range of yummy snacks and beverages. In addition, now and then, check out the playroom for a fun break or join our exciting parties and or team activities such as Lab days, Running team, movie nights in our cinema, or a Geek lunch. There’s something for everyone!


**Come As You Are**
 Truecaller is diverse, equal, and inclusive. We need a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, beliefs, and experiences to keep building our great products. No matter where you are based, which language you speak, your accent, race, religion, color, nationality, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, etc. All those things make you who you are, and that’s why we would love to meet you.
   

  

 Job info
   

  

 Location
   

  

**Stockholm, Sverige**
 Category
   

  

**Data Science**
 Team
   

  

**Search**
 Posted
   

  

**today**

title: Product Manager to team Seller Success
description:
**Help shape the product behind one of life’s biggest decisions (no pressure, right!?). Join our Seller Success team as our new Product Manager – the crew is on a mission to make selling your home feel a little less like a rollercoaster and a lot more like a guided tour. You’ll be working on a product that practically everyone in Sweden knows and loves. In fact, 9 out of 10 homes are sold on our platform. So yes, your work will directly influence the housing market – and possibly even dinner table conversations across the country.** 
  

  

 ☝🏽 Please apply by September 25 at the latest.
   

  

 We’re at an exciting stage where we’re taking the next step in how we support our sellers. The basics are solid: strong brand recognition, impressive conversion rates, and a product people genuinely enjoy using (rare, we know!). But the best part? The potential ahead is even greater.
   

  

 As Product Manager, you’ll steer both strategy and execution: turning customer insights into brilliant new solutions, developing our offerings, and making sure every seller feels guided, confident, and supported throughout their journey. Along the way, you’ll collaborate with designers, engineers, and other bright minds to create experiences that delight our sellers, while also driving growth and value for the company.
   

  

**What You’ll Be Up To 🏡** 
  

  

 As a Product Manager in the Seller Success team, you’ll set the direction and define the long-term vision for our product, making sure it aligns with Hemnet’s overall goals. You’ll work closely with colleagues in tech, UX, analytics and across the business to turn strategies into reality and deliver strong go-to-market plans.
   

  

 Your focus will always be on tuning in the customer: using insights and data to continuously refine and personalize the seller journey. Through discovery, testing and iteration, you’ll make sure every step of the flow adds value and feels effortless for our users.
   

  

 In this role, you’ll also be a catalyst for collaboration and growth. You’ll inspire your team to challenge assumptions, prioritize what matters most, and work seamlessly across departments. When faced with complexity or ambiguity, you’ll bring clarity through adaptive communication and decisive action. And, just as importantly, you’ll embrace feedback and use it to drive continuous improvement, for yourself, your team, and the way we build products at Hemnet.
   

  

**What You Bring 🌟** 
  

  

 We strongly believe in action over perfection; and this way of working is part of your spine, the testing, the trying, sometimes failing but always learning. So with that said, you are curious, bold and challenge old truths and outdated ways of working.
   

  

 At the same time, you know that product management is never a solo mission. You thrive in collaboration, bringing people together around a common vision and making sure every voice is heard. For you, success is something we achieve as a team, whether that’s with engineers, designers, analysts, or stakeholders across the company.
   

  

 You combine strategic thinking with hands-on pragmatism, and you’re just as comfortable in the weeds of discovery and iteration as you are in setting a long-term product direction. You communicate clearly, adapt quickly, and inspire trust by balancing empathy with decisiveness. Above all, you care deeply about creating real value for users and know that the best products are built when we win together.
   

  

**Required Skills** 
  

  

* Relevant experience in product management, business development or similar, preferably from tech scale-ups or mature companies with commercial product exposure
* Strong commercial product experience
* Proven expertise in creating product strategy and vision, and experience with Agile product development
* Strong background in product discovery and user research, with a data-driven approach to decision making
* Excellent stakeholder management skills and the ability to lead and inspire cross-functional teams
* Deep understanding of Agile or Lean practices, with hands-on experience driving iterative product development, continuous improvement, and fostering a culture of collaboration
* Fluency in Swedish and English


  

  

 Bonus
   

  

* Hands-on technical experience and familiarity with Conversion Rate Optimization (CRO)


  

  

**Hello from** 
**Alicia** 
**,** 
**Johan** 
**and** 
**Yichu** 
**! 👋🏽** 
  

  

 Hi and welcome to our team! With us, you’ll find a group of curious, dedicated, and humble colleagues who love collaborating and developing our products - whether we’re working on UX or development. We work closely together with great trust and high autonomy, which allows us to be both creative and efficient. At the same time, our goals are ambitious, and that makes working here a lot of fun!
   

  

 The best part of our everyday work? Taking on exciting challenges in a domain that is constantly evolving. We do it our way: with the freedom to test ideas, simple tools to capture insights from users, and clear goals that let us really see the impact of our work on the business.
   

  

 We hope you’ll bring the same dedication, a business-driven mindset, but also clarity and humility. Together, we’ll continue to create truly great products for all home sellers out there, giving them the best possible conditions to succeed with their sales.
   

  

 We look forward to building the sales journey with you - and having fun along the way!
   

  

**A Note on Inclusion** 
 💚
   

  

 At Hemnet, we believe that diversity in gender, sexual orientation, ability, neurodiversity, cultural background and life experience makes us stronger. We welcome applicants of all identities and backgrounds.
   

  

 If you meet many but not all of the requirements, we encourage you to apply. We value curiosity, a strong sense of purpose and the motivation to learn and grow, alongside your skills and experiences.

title: Product Domain Lead (Temporary Assignment/Consultancy Opportunity)
description:
**Temporary Assignment/Consultancy Opportunity** 
*Product Leaders out there, we have a longer temporary assignment open as of mid October to August 2026. We welcome both independent consultants and consultancy firms to present candidates for this role. We also want to emphasize that we care deeply about diversity. We strongly encourage consultancy partners to reflect this in their submissions, i.e., at least present candidates out of gender diversity.* 
  

  

 At Hemnet, we don’t just build products - we shape the way people find their future homes. Now, we’re on the lookout for a Product Domain Lead to join us on a temporary assignment/consultancy basis and help drive one of our most exciting product domains forward. This role isn’t just about strategy on paper - it’s about inspiring teams, leading change, and making an impact that moves the needle for our company and our customers. Your leadership will shape how we grow, evolve, and set the standard for innovation in our business.
   

  

 🌟
 **What you’ll do** 
  

  

 As our Product Domain Lead, you’ll be the visionary who not only defines the strategy for your domain but also sets the metrics that truly move the business forward. You’ll have the chance to inspire and grow leaders - guiding Product Managers to unlock their potential and tackle complex challenges with confidence.
   

  

 You’ll be a connector, building strong bridges across teams and functions to ensure collaboration flows seamlessly and results land with real impact. With curiosity and courage, you’ll encourage experimentation, champion data-driven decisions, and dare to push boundaries to find smarter, better ways of working.
   

  

 And through it all, you’ll keep the team focused on what matters most - clearing the path, setting priorities, and ensuring we deliver outcomes (
 *action over perfection* 
 ) that make a meaningful difference for Hemnet and our customers.
   

  

 🧩
 **What makes you the right fit** 
  

  

* You’ve led other Product Managers (at least 3+ year in a domain-like structure).
* You’ve navigated complexity in a product organization spanning consumer-facing and partner-led products.
* You’re a curious and courageous leader who tunes in, and thrives on inspiring change.
* B2B experience? Even better - you’ll know how to spot what should stay, what should go, and what new ideas are worth launching.


  

  

**A note to Consultancy companies** 
 ☝🏽
   

  

 Present from a diversity perspective and do not forget candidate availability (open to start when) and hourly cost.
   

  

 If any questions, please contact julia.maric@hemnet.se
