We independently support our clients, present our results to their decision makers, and agree on the next steps.
   

  

 What You'll Bring
   

  

**You can help us make a difference if you**
* bring a completed a degree in computer science, (business) informatics, or a related area with above-average grades
* have at least eight years of substantial experience in IT consulting and the lead design and management of IT strategy and implementation projects
* already captured project-related management experience as the lead of teams with more than five people
* know how to plan IT initiatives and build solid business cases
* optimally steer decisions towards the goal and master escalating situations with an eye to solutions - even in complex organizational structures
* have successfully acquired consulting projects
* are excellent at understanding and communicating complex topics in English


 Who You'll Work With
   

  

**Shape the world of tomorrow**
* Independently contribute to build close client relationships - and as their trusted advisor, you are the first to whom they turn
* Acquire new projects and challenges for our company and yourself
* Be in charge of planning, leading, and assuring quality for strategic IT projects - we work with passion for our clients' long-term success
* Get to use your comprehensive knowledge of technology and industry understanding to provide both internal and external stakeholders with the orientation they need in critical project phases and challenging situations
* Think across projects and connecting factors, and plan resources to achieve the best efficiency possible
* Take ownership for presenting key project results at the highest level of client management
* Work with an entrepreneurial approach and passion to advance BCG Platinion with your contributions to people development, recruiting, and practice areas


 Additional info
   

  

**How To Grow With Us**
 We guarantee constant development incentives in an open and rewarding work environment! Together with a dedicated team of talented colleagues, you get to work on new challenges every day. Individual training offers and a culture of open feedback will provide the framework needed to explore and perfect personal strengths. Our modern structures allow focusing on the essence of our work - with easy travel booking, an excellent back-office support and comprehensive Knowledge Center. With our regular office Fridays and legendary events, we nurture a strong and close team network beyond our case work.
   

  

*BCG Platinion is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, age, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity / expression, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected under national, provincial, or local law, where applicable.*
*#BCGPlatinion*
 Boston Consulting Group is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, age, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity / expression, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected under national, provincial, or local law, where applicable, and those with criminal histories will be considered in a manner consistent with applicable state and local laws.
   

  

 BCG is an E - Verify Employer. Click here for more information on E-Verify.

title: Developer Baseband L1
description:
**Join our Team**
**About this opportunity!**
 Are you ready to shape the future of 5G?
   

  

 Within the L1 Software Development team in the Product Engineering Group RU Baseband Software, we are dedicated to designing and implementing Physical Layer Baseband functions for our Radio products. Our goal is to maintain Ericsson’s leadership in the market by delivering cutting-edge L1 solutions across diverse deployment scenarios, frequency bands, radio platforms and 3GPP/ORAN standards.
   

  

 We are currently looking for a L1 Software Developer to join our outstanding team in Kista. In this role, you’ll be working on our 5G/6G RAN L1 Software product, playing a key role in ensuring its performance and success.
   

  

 J
 **oin us at the forefront of wireless innovation!**
**What You Will Do**
**As a member of the L1 team, you’ll shape system architecture, implement key features, and ensure high-performance deployment. Your focus will be on the Physical Layer (L1) components of Baseband software—core building blocks of our leading 5G RAN solutions and future 6G technologies** 
 .
   

  

**What You'll Do:**
* Collaborate with engineers to design/systemize, develop, and maintain software components essential to product functionality.
* Enhance existing features and develop new ones, with a focus on performance, scalability, and reliability—leveraging Ericsson’s evolving Multi-Core Architecture Platform.
* Participate in code reviews, testing, and quality assurance activities.
* Troubleshoot and resolve software issues to ensure seamless operation.
* Stay current with industry trends and best practices, applying new knowledge to improve product innovation.
* Work within a dynamic, agile development environment to meet timelines and goals.


**Skills You Bring**
* Passion and interest in design, continuous learning, and technical excellence.
* Proficiency in C/C++ and a solid and proven expertise in embedded software design.
* Expertise in multi-core architectures and real-time systems.
* Domain knowledge in wireless communications, especially in signal processing, 4G/5G NR Physical Layer functions (highly desirable).
* Strong collaboration skills – thrive in international, multi-site teams; open communicator with a proactive, can-do attitude.
* Comfortable in fast-paced, agile environments; committed to delivering high-quality software on time.
* A drive for innovation – proactive mindset for continuous improvement in development practices.
* Master’s degree (or equivalent) in Electrical Engineering, Software Engineering, Computer Science, Wireless Communications, or a related field.
* Relevant experience, 2–6 years in embedded software development, ideally in telecom or a related industry


**Why join Ericsson?**
 At Ericsson, you´ll have an outstanding opportunity. The chance to use your skills and imagination to push the boundaries of what´s possible. To build solutions never seen before to some of the world’s toughest problems. You´ll be challenged, but you won’t be alone. You´ll be joining a team of diverse innovators, all driven to go beyond the status quo to craft what comes next.
   

  

**What happens once you apply?**
 Click Here to find all you need to know about what our typical hiring process looks like.
   

  

 Encouraging a diverse and inclusive organization is core to our values at Ericsson, that's why we champion it in everything we do. We truly believe that by collaborating with people with different experiences we drive innovation, which is essential for our future growth. We encourage people from all backgrounds to apply and realize their full potential as part of our Ericsson team. Ericsson is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. learn more.
   

  

**Primary country and city:** 
 Sweden (SE) || Stockholm
   

  

**Req ID:** 
 764679

title: Cyber Security Project Manager
description:
**About Us**
 Integrity360 is one of Europe’s leading cyber security specialists operating from office locations spread out across Europe, providing a comprehensive range of professional, support and managed cyber security services for our 300+ clients. With four top-class Security Operation Centers, we offer a complete end-to-end security services covering our clients’ security from every angle. Our services include Managed Security, Cyber Security Testing, Incident Response, Security Integration, PCI Compliance and Cyber Risk & Assurance services.
   

  

 What sets Integrity360 apart is our excellent team of people that drive the business forward. The company was founded with a focus on technical expertise and that philosophy remains today. The skills and experience in our company are some of the greatest in the industry and clients remain with Integrity360 because they can rely on and trust us to go above and beyond to ensure their needs are met. Listed multiple times on Gartner Market Guides for Managed Security Services.
   

  

**Job Overview**
 We are seeking an experienced and highly-skilled Cyber Security Project Manager to oversee the planning, execution, and delivery of complex security projects within our organization. The successful candidate will have experience of managing straight consultancy projects, as well as onboarding new services into a Managed Services environment.
   

  

 The role requires the management of cross-functional teams, coordinating with Presales, Professional Services and Service Delivery and key client stakeholders to ensure the successful deployment of security initiatives that protect IT infrastructure, data, and digital assets.
   

  

 You will have a strong background in Project Management with a proven track record in cyber security, coupled with strong leadership skills and the ability to navigate a fast-paced and dynamic environment.
   

  

 The successful candidate will have experience across a number of the technologies we provide, such as EDR, XDR, NDR, MDR, TVM, Firewalls etc and will ideally have delivered projects using products from class-leading vendors including Microsoft, Rapid7, CrowdStrike, Trellix, Sentinel One, Splunk, Qualys, DarkTrace, Vectra, Fortinet and Checkpoint.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* Project Management: Lead the end-to-end lifecycle of cyber security projects from handover to completion, including initiation, planning, execution, monitoring, and closure, aligning with business goals and security objectives.
* Stakeholder Management: Collaborate with internal teams, clients, external vendors and senior leadership to define project requirements, timelines and deliverables. Communicate project status, risks, and issues to stakeholders at all levels of the organization.
* Risk Management: Identify and assess security risks throughout the project lifecycle. Develop and implement mitigation strategies to address risks and ensure minimal impact to project timelines and organizational security posture.
* Team Coordination: Work closely with cybersecurity engineers, analysts, IT staff, and third-party vendors to ensure seamless collaboration and resource allocation. Facilitate project team meetings and track progress against milestones.
* Security Requirements Management: Ensure that all projects adhere to internal security policies, industry standards, and regulatory requirements (e.g., GDPR, NIST, ISO 27001).
* Budget and Resource Management: Oversee the project budget, ensuring efficient use of resources. Track project expenditures and adjust project plans as necessary to meet budgetary constraints.
* Documentation & Reporting: Maintain comprehensive project documentation, including project plans, RAID logs, project change documentation, risk/issue acceptance, progress reports, and post-implementation reviews. Provide regular updates to executive leadership on project health and security posture improvements.
* Continuous Improvement: Identify opportunities to enhance processes and practices, contributing to the overall improvement of the organization’s project delivery function.


**Qualifications** 
  

  

* Education: Bachelor’s degree in Information Technology, Cybersecurity, Computer Science, or a related field. A Master’s degree or professional certifications (e.g., PMP, CISSP, CISM, CISA) is a plus.
* Experience:
+ At least five years experience managing IT projects, including a minimum of two years managing cyber security projects, preferably within large enterprise environments.
+ A minimum of two years experience of working within a Managed Services environment, delivering multiple concurrent projects to a range of clients operating in multiple sectors.

* Technical Skills:
+ Strong understanding of cyber security concepts, risk management and security frameworks (e.g., NIST, ISO 27001, CIS Controls).
+ Familiarity with security technologies such as firewalls, intrusion detection systems (IDS), endpoint protection, encryption, identity and access management (IAM) and security information and event management (SIEM).
+ Experience with cloud security, application security and network security is highly desirable.

* Project Management Skills:
+ Expertise in project management methodologies (Waterfall, Agile etc.).
+ Proven ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously while maintaining quality and deadlines.
+ Strong organizational, time management and multitasking skills.

* Communication Skills:
+ Excellent written and verbal communication skills, with the ability to articulate complex cyber security concepts to non-technical stakeholders.
+ Strong presentation skills and the ability to lead meetings and briefings with executives.

* Certifications (Preferred):
+ Prince2 Practitioner
+ PMP (Project Management Professional)
+ CISSP (Certified Information Systems Security Professional)
+ CISM (Certified Information Security Manager)
+ ITIL or other relevant certifications.


**Personal Attributes**
* Strong leadership and team-building skills, with a collaborative and solution-oriented approach.
* Analytical mindset with an ability to proactively identify and address potential issues.
* Ability to work under pressure and meet tight deadlines while maintaining a focus on security best practices.
* Detail-oriented and highly organized, with the ability to manage competing priorities in a fast-paced environment.

title: Junior consultants to Deal Advisory, Transaction Services - August 2026
description:
*KPMG Deal Advisory is looking for driven and talented Associates to join our Transaction Services team in Stockholm with start August 2026. We are a leading provider of M&A services in Sweden and globally, and we work with prominent Private Equity and corporate clients in a collaborative and high-performing international company.*
**The role**
 As an Associate with KPMG Deal Advisory within the Transaction Services team, you will have the opportunity to perform and enhance your skill in buy- and sell-side transactions, providing financial due diligence (“DD”). In a financial DD, you will work with analysis of target company data to find key drivers behind the historical financial performance, challenging assumptions about future performance, understanding the cash flow cycle and finding potential liabilities and risks which could impact valuation and negotiation of the target company.
   

  

**What We Offer**
 We are dedicated to support you in your career and personal development, and we offer a mentorship program under senior transaction specialists. We also provide support and training to help you grow quickly in a professional and forward-leaning environment with global opportunities. Our team serves the largest Private Equity and Corporate clients across Sweden, and you will have the chance to work with engaged and dedicated colleagues in a friendly and inclusive environment.
   

  

 We offer a competitive compensation package and an important work-life balance approach to the work we do. Take advantage of working in a dynamic environment with engaged and dedicated colleagues. We often work in teams and our work is largely performed in the office. We do however apply a flexible and hybrid approach to our workplace where it is possible to work both from our offices and from distance. Our employment package includes 6 weeks paid holiday, generous employer pension contributions through collective bargaining agreements, various health and wellness benefits, and more!
   

  

 ,
   

  

 To be successful in this role, we think that you should have:
   

  

* An academic background in Business, Engineering, Finance, or similar.
* A business mindset and an analytical way of thinking
* Proficiency in Microsoft Excel and PowerPoint
* 0-3 years of work experience. Meritorious if you have experience in accounting/audit.
* Fluency in Swedish and English is a requirement
* Extracurricular activities such as work experience or engagement in student organisations are advantageous.


 If you are a driven individual longing to work in a professional environment that offers a steep learning curve, we encourage you to apply. We value diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive culture where everyone feels valued, respected, and supported. Join us and help us build a better future.
   

  

**Want to make a difference with us?** 
 Apply by submitting your CV, cover letter and university transcript as soon as possible, but no later than
 **5th of October.**
 As a first step of the recruitment process, we use capacity and personality tests. The tests are used to make the selection process as objective as possible. You will receive the tests by e-mail shortly after submitting your application and we will not process your application until the tests have been completed. If you move on to the next step in the recruitment process, you will be invited to an assessment day at our office in Stockholm in middle of October.
   

  

 If you have any questions, please contact Amanda Engberg, amanda.engberg@kpmg.se
   

  

 We look forward to receiving your application!

title: Integration Developer
description:
We now have a new requirement and are looking for a consultant colleague with the qualifications listed below. The position is part of our consulting business, which means you will be employed by us and work either with clients or on internal projects and assignments.
   

  

*As part of your application, you may be presented to clients/partners as part of the recruitment process. If selected for the assignment, you will be employed by us and work either with clients or on internal projects and assignments as part of our consulting business.*
**Role:**
* create technical solution design for integration projects;
* implement, test and document integration solutions;
* contribute to continuous improvement of integration platform on-premise and in the cloud;
* work closely with business analysts and IT Architects in different projects;
* develop and maintain integrations using SAP Business Technology Platform Integration Suite (SAP BTP IS);
* support to prepare the Integration Competence Center team to upskill and learn about SAP BTP IS development;
* review and document integration patterns in SAP BTP IS to standardize them for future use; and enable self-service and end-to-end monitoring capabilities in SAP BTP IS, if technically possible.


****Essential requirements:****
* Proficiency in SAP Integration Suite (SAP IS)
* Experience with cloud-based solutions and integration of SAP and non-SAP systems
* Experience with monitoring tools such as Prometheus, Grafana, or similar
* Familiarity with self-service tools and automation
* Understanding about Seeburger and how to build a performant, secure and highly available platform
* Ability to analyze and resolve integration issues, ensuring smooth operation of the integration suite
* Strong communication and collaboration skills
* Ability to work independently and as part of a team


**Last day to apply** 
 : 28-09-2025
   

  

**About Us**
 We currently employ experienced consultants in areas such as System Development, AI, Machine Learning, Testing, Cloud, Infra DevOps, and IT Project Management.
   

  

 Working at Deploja is something entirely different from working at an ordinary consulting company—and we are really proud of that. So, what makes us unique?
   

  

 We simply offer more than just a high salary and greater freedom; that’s just the beginning. With us, you’ll find the work environment and opportunities you deserve. Welcome to Deploja, where the grass is indeed greener!
   

  

**Vi erbjuder dig följande, Valet är ditt!**
 🚀 Exciting assignments with our many clients. We focus on long-term projects, which gives you the opportunity to create value for the client while also developing yourself.
   

  

 🌟 A secure monthly salary – together we’ll agree on a base salary depending on your assignments.
   

  

 🚗 Company car – we encourage you to choose an electric car for a more sustainable future.
   

  

 💼 Occupational pension and great opportunities for salary conversion.
   

  

 🌴 Vacation – Would you like more than 30 days of vacation, perhaps 60 days?
   

  

 🏥 Private health insurance, accident insurance, and life insurance for increased security.
   

  

 📚 Skills development – you set your own budget and choose the training you wish to attend.
   

  

 🕑 Quality of life – Are you struggling to balance everyday life and wish to work a little less while still earning as much, if not more?
   

  

*We handle applications continuously, and due to the high workload, it's especially important to include a short motivation for the position, explaining how you meet the requirements.*

title: Erfaren konsult inom IT-rådgivning med fokus på finansiella tjänster och banksektorn
description:
Deloitte erbjuder tjänster inom revision, business consulting, finansiell rådgivning, riskhantering, skatterådgivning och relaterade områden. Med mer än 457 000 medarbetare i över 150 länder hjälper vi våra klienter och vår omvärld att lösa komplexa problem och nå högt uppsatta mål. Det som definierar Deloitte är vår strävan att göra en meningsfull skillnad. Vi tror att när våra klienter och vårt samhälle blir starkare, blir vi det också! Det är därför självklart för oss att driva initiativ så som WorldClass, WorldClimate samt vår strategi för mångfald.
   

  

  




**Jobbeskrivning**

**Är du redo för nästa steg i din karriär och att bli en del av vårt framgångsrika team?**




 Inom teamet Technology Strategy & Transformation samarbetar du för att hjälpa våra kunder att utveckla teknikstrategier och lösningar som inte bara skapar affärsvärde och driver prestation, utan som också stödjer användningen av framväxande teknologier för att ligga steget före i det digitala landskapet. Från att utforma strategier och målbilder till att implementera våra kunders framtida IT-verksamhet och dess lösningar, kommer du att bidra till att lösa våra kunders mest komplexa utmaningar inom teknik och digitalisering. Tillsammans med kollegorna i teamet arbetar du primärt med CIO: s och andra IT-chefers agenda inom områden såsom IT-strategi, styrning och operativa modeller, IT-arkitektur, IT sourcing & upphandlingsrådgivning, IT-kostnadsbesparing och effektivisering, samt storskaliga tekniktransformationer.
   

  

  





**Rollen som Senior Manager**




 Vi letar efter en Senior Manager med 8–10 års erfarenhet från en välrenommerad konsultverksamhet till teamet med basering i Stockholm.
   

  

  





 Vi hjälper våra kunder att utveckla teknologistrategier och lösningar som skapar bestående affärsvärde. Från artikulering av strategier till design av IT-lösningar, bidrar du med värdefull kunskap och erfarenhet till våra kunders mest komplexa utmaningar. Förutom klientarbete, arbetar teamet kontinuerligt med att vidareutveckla vår framgångsrika konsultverksamhet inom strategisk IT-rådgivning. Då arbetet bedrivs i team och i nära samverkan med våra kunder, är det viktigt att du känner dig trygg med att leda och coacha yngre kollegor och personer inom våra kunders verksamhet.
   

  

  





 Våra kunder utgör några av Sveriges mest framgångsrika bolag inom en rad olika branscher, vilket ger en stor möjlighet att växa som konsult och dra lärdomar från olika typer av miljöer.
   

  

  





**Ditt bidrag**



* Leda IT-rådgivnings- och transformationsprojekt från planering till genomförande med fokus inom finansiell sektor och i synnerhet banker.
* Hantera och coacha yngre kollegor i deras individuella utvecklingsresor och i samband med kundleverans.
* Leda affärsutveckling inom ditt fokusområde genom identifiering och bearbetning av nya möjligheter till kundsamarbeten, samt som del av detta samarbeta med kollegor för att dra nytta av vår samlade kompetens och kunskapsbas.
* Utveckla och upprätthålla förtroendefulla relationer både internt och externt.
* Aktivt bidra till intern verksamhetsutveckling inom ditt fokusområde.


**Kvalifikationer**
* Du är en affärsdriven person med tidigare erfarenhet av arbete som managementkonsult och som besitter en bred förståelse för IT/teknik och dess affärstillämpningar och nyttor.
* Du har erfarenhet av att interagera med seniora IT- och teknikledare i stora, globala företag och har förmågan att föra breda samtal om de mest angelägna frågorna på ”CIO-agendan”.
* Du sporras av försäljningsmål och har förmåga att självständigt och i samarbete med andra driva affärsresultat med hjälp av sitt professionella nätverk bestående av interna och externa kontakter.
* Du är en lagspelare med erfarenhet av att leda diversifierade och högpresterande team, samt erfarenhet av att leverera resultat av hög kvalitet i projekt som utnyttjar teknologi för att skapa affärsvärde.
* Du har 8–10 års samlad relevant arbetslivserfarenhet som managementkonsult inom strategisk IT-rådgivning och transformation.
* Du har avlagt examen inom ett relevant område, exempelvis data- och systemvetenskap eller industriell ekonomi med IT-inriktning.
* Du behärskar svenska och engelska flytande i tal och skrift, ytterligare språkkunskaper är ett plus.


 Specifika kvalifikationer för rollen:
   

  

  

* Du har relevant konsulterfarenhet inom IT-rådgivning kopplat till bolag inom finansiell sektor och banker.
* Du har arbetat i roller som exempelvis IT- eller koncernarkitekt, alternativt IT-projektledare i större transformationsprojekt kopplat till bank, såsom exempelvis byte eller modernisering av kärnsystem.
* Du har mycket god affärs- och IT-kunskap om något eller flera produktområden såsom Trading & Capital Markets (värdepappershandel), Capital Management (kapitalförvaltning), Loans (lån) och Payments (betalningar).
* Du har god förståelse för olika systemlösningar och leverantörsmarknaden kopplat till branschen och produktområdena.


**Ytterligare information**

 Som en del av Deloitte får du tillgång till världens största konsultnätverk tillsammans med kunniga och engagerade kollegor som är experter inom sina områden. Du får arbeta med spännande, komplexa uppdrag, både på global och nordisk nivå, i team som alltid värderar ditt perspektiv. Vi lägger stor vikt vid att erbjuda dig möjligheter att driva din personliga utveckling. Vi erbjuder dig praktisk erfarenhet, en personlig coach som långsiktigt stöttar dig i din karriär och kontinuerlig feedback och support från mer erfarna kollegor.
   

  

  





 Du får möjlighet att arbeta i ett företag som hjälper andra aktörer i deras resa mot en mer hållbar organisation, samtidigt som vi arbetar målmedvetet med våra egna ambitioner inom både klimat, miljö och socialt ansvar. Vi ser ett värde i att våra medarbetare har olika erfarenheter vilket främjar nytänkande och bidrar till fler perspektiv.
   

  

  





**Ansökan**




 Du ansöker online. Din ansökan ska bestå av:
   

  

  




* CV
* En motivering till:
	+ Varför du är intresserad av Deloitte och rollen
	+ Vad du tror att du kan tillföra i rollen baserat på din profil och kvalifikationer


 Som ett kvalitativt led i Deloittes rekryteringsprocess genomgår våra slutkandidater en bakgrundskontroll, detta för att öka kännedomen om våra framtida medarbetare, trygga arbetsmiljön för våra medarbetare och möta regelkrav. Processen för bakgrundskontroller genomförs i samarbete med ToFindOut. https://tofindout.se/sv/faq/. För de tjänster som Deloitte efterfrågar universitetsbetyg genomförs en verifiering som en del i rekryteringsprocessen. För frågor hänvisar vi till ansvarig rekryterare i processen.
   

  

  


**Frågor**




 Om du har frågor om tjänsten är du välkommen att kontakta Jonas Widell på jwidell@deloitte.se. Har du frågor om rekryteringsprocessen är du välkommen att kontakta ansvarig rekryterare Anna Taube på ataube@deloitte.se.
   

  

  





**What impact will you make?**




 På Deloitte gör ditt arbete en meningsfull skillnad, varje dag, medan du växer i en inkluderande företagskultur av samarbete och hög prestation. Utöver att skapa lösningar strävar vi efter att göra en positiv och avgörande skillnad för andra i vår omgivning, våra klienter och samhället. På Deloitte hittar du tidigare dolda möjligheter att lyckas och inser din fulla potential.

title: Animator
description:
Do you love bringing characters to life?
   

  

 You see every movement as a chance to add emotion, style, and gameplay clarity. You know the difference between something that moves, and something that moves you.
   

  

 As an Animator at Snowprint Studios, you’ll help define the personality of our games. From expressive heroes to strange, multi-legged creatures, you’ll create animations that feel great, look sharp, and make gameplay better. You’ll work on
 *Tacticus* 
 , our award-winning strategy game, and collaborate closely with artists, designers, and developers across disciplines.
   

  

 We’re a small, experienced team that values kindness, creativity, and self-leadership. We move fast, give feedback generously, and trust people to own their craft. You’ll have room to push ideas, test quickly, and ship animations that players around the world will love.
   

  

**What You’ll Be Doing**
 First of all, animation, of course. But you also adjust 3D models and perhaps even build them, rig them, animate them and implement them. It’s varied work. You’ll animate characters, props, UI and more, crafting fluid, responsive animations that elevate gameplay and fit seamlessly into the game experience.
   

  

 You’ll work in Maya and bring your experience with FK/IK animation, rigging, and mesh adaptation to support the needs of the project. You’ll also work with Unity3D, using both realtime and baked physics, cloth simulation, and dynamic forces to enhance fidelity and feel.
   

  

 You’ll be part of a collaborative team, working closely with Art Directors and cross-discipline stakeholders to problem-solve and improve the pipeline. Your insights will help shape how animation supports storytelling, gameplay, and the overall player experience.
   

  

**Is this you?**
 You’ve spent a few years animating for games and know how to balance creativity with technical constraints. You bring strong fundamentals and a passion for gameplay-first animation.
   

  

 You know your way around Maya and game engines (we use Unity3D) and have a solid grasp of game art pipelines. You’re comfortable adapting meshes and tweaking models for animation needs, and you’ve worked with real time and baked physics, including cloth, rigid body, and soft body dynamics.
   

  

 You’re a strong communicator who thrives in a collaborative environment, always ready to give and receive feedback. You stay curious, open-minded, and eager to explore new tools, techniques, or style-switching between cartoony and realistic as needed. A deep passion for games and a belief in the power of team-driven development drives everything you do
   

  

**Where you’ll work**
 Our Stockholm studio is in Södermalm and our Berlin studio is in Mitte, with a hybrid working model. We work from the office Tuesdays and Fridays, to allow for closer collaboration and socializing, other days it's up to everyone where they feel most comfortable to work. We support hybrid work by supplying you with the right setup and tools.
   

  

**About Snowprint Studios**
 Snowprint Studios believes great games are created by teams of talented, kind and creative individuals in a friendly, supportive and inspiring environment - while maintaining a sustainable life-work balance.
   

  

 For more information on Snowprint Studios go to snowprintstudios.com and follow us on Facebook and Twitter.
   

  

 At Snowprint Studios, we embrace diversity both in the worlds we create and in our workplace. Join us in shaping the future of gaming!
   

  

* Pocket Gamer Awards 2022 winner ‘mobile game of the year’ and ‘best strategy game’
* Pocket Gamer Awards 2024 winner 'best game we are still playing’ and finalist 'best developer'

title: Senior Integrationsutvecklare
description:
Vi har nu ett nytt behov och söker därför en konsultkollega med nedan kvalifikationer. Tjänsten är en del av vår konsultverksamhet vilket innebär att du blir anställd av oss och arbetar hos kund alt. interna projekt och åtaganden.
   

  

**Din profil (Skall krav)**
* Minst 5 års arbetslivserfarenhet från systemutveckling
* Minst 2 års arbetslivserfarenhet av applikationsutveckling som bygger på


 mikroservicearkitektur och container-teknik.
   

  

* Minst 3 års arbetslivserfarenhet av utveckling med Java.
* Minst 2 års erfarenhet från att ha arbetat med system- och integrationsutveckling


 där alla nedanstående teknologier har ingått:
   

  

* XML/XSLT
* JMS
* Web service (SOAP/REST)
* Minst 2 års arbetslivserfarenhet från systemutveckling mot Apache Camel


**Meriterande**
* Minst två års erfarenhet från att ha arbetat med utveckling av integrationer i Oracle SOA Suite och Oracle WebLogic
* Minst 2 års erfarenhet av arbete med mikroservices baserat på Spring/Spring boot
* Minst 2 års arbete med API’er i en API Gateway


**Sista ansökningdatum:** 
 29-09-2025
   

  

**Om Deploja**
 Vi sysselsätter idag erfarna konsulter, inom bl.a. Systemutveckling, Test, Arkitektur, IT-Projektledning, IT-Säkerhet.
   

  

 Att jobba på Deploja är något helt annat än att arbeta på ett vanligt konsultbolag – och det är vi riktigt stolta över. Vad är det då som gör oss unika?
   

  

 Vi erbjuder helt enkelt mer än bara hög lön och större frihet, det är bara början. Hos oss hittar du den arbetsmiljö och de möjligheter du förtjänar. Välkommen till Deploja, där gräset faktiskt är grönare!
   

  

**Vi erbjuder dig följande, Valet är ditt!**
 🚀 Spännande uppdrag hos våra många kunder. Vi fokuserar på långsiktiga uppdrag, vilket ger dig möjlighet att skapa värde för kunden samtidigt som du utvecklas själv.
   

  

 🌟 En trygg månadslön – tillsammans bestämmer vi en grundlön baserad på dina uppdrag.
   

  

 🚗 Tjänstebil – vi uppmuntrar dig att välja en elbil för en mer hållbar framtid.
   

  

 💼 Tjänstepension och stora möjligheter till löneväxling.
   

  

 🌴 Semester - Önskar du mer än 30 dagar semester, kanske 60 dagar?
   

  

 🏥 Privat sjukvårdsförsäkring, olycksfallsförsäkring och livförsäkring för ökad trygghet.
   

  

 📚 Kompetensutveckling – du får själv sätta din budget och välja vilka utbildningar du vill delta i.
   

  

 🕑 Livskvalitet - Har du kanske svårt att få ihop pusslet i vardagen och önskar arbeta lite mindre och ändå kunna tjäna lika mycket om inte mer?
   

  

* Vi hanterar ansökningar löpande, med hänsyn till höga arbetstrycket är det extra viktigt med en kort motivering för tjänsten som förklarar hur man möter kraven.

title: Staff Engineer - Audio
description:
**Build something monumental for Healthcare!** 




 At Tandem Health we’re reimagining healthcare by putting clinicians first. Our platform - designed by clinicians, for clinicians - is built on deep insight into real-world pain points, with intuitive medical notes and workflows that truly support patient care.
 



 We’re a fast-scaling health-tech company backed by top investors and expanding globally. We move fast, stay curious, and believe building something that matters starts with an extraordinary team. If you're passionate about impact and innovation, we'd love to meet you!
 



**About The Role & You** 




 You’re relentlessly driven to understand how things work, the kind of person who dives deep when something breaks and won’t stop until you understand it and it’s fixed. You have applied this drive to understand the endlessly complex world of audio. A medium where edge-cases are the norm and any non standard processing requires a deep understanding..
 



 You thrive in this complexity. You’ve built audio pipelines end-to-end and felt the real-world pain of making them work at scale, from managing flaky devices to handling buffering, mixing, streaming, and transcription. Where others see chaos, you see a system to be understood, stabilized, and made reliable.
 



 At Tandem Health, you’ll lead the effort to build and scale our massive audio pipelines that power real-time healthcare conversations. From ensuring the right microphone is active to delivering accurate transcripts, you’ll make sure our audio systems are seamless, stable, and ready to scale across the continent.
 



 This is a high-impact role where you’ll shape both our technical architecture and our engineering culture. If you’re excited by solving deeply technical problems in one of the most complex and rewarding mediums, we’d love to meet you.
 



 What You Will Do
 


* Lead the design, development, and scaling of our audio pipelines, enabling real-time streaming of healthcare conversations with high reliability.
* Build systems that span the full chain, from device input and buffering to mixing, streaming, and transcription, ensuring accurate and timely delivery of audio data.
* Ensure stability, performance, and scalability of our audio infrastructure as we scale to support healthcare organizations across Europe.
* Collaborate across the stack, from frontend UX for audio-native products to backend processing systems and databases that handle high-volume streams.
* Drive best practices in audio engineering, setting technical direction and standards while mentoring engineers working on audio-related systems.
* Continuously improve our audio technology, iterating on tooling, monitoring, and evaluation to ensure high quality and reliability in production.



 What You Bring
 


* A proven track record of building and deploying large-scale audio pipelines in production environments.
* Deep experience working across the full stack, from frontend applications to backend services and databases, with a focus on audio-heavy systems.
* Hands-on experience building audio-native products, where audio is central to the user experience.
* A deep curiosity for complex systems and a relentless drive to make them work - you go beyond surface fixes to understand what’s really happening under the hood.
* A strong ability to design systems that remain stable, performant, and reliable at scale, even under real-world constraints and device variability.
* Excellent collaboration and communication skills, with the ability to work closely with cross-functional teams to build robust, high-quality systems.



 Bonus Points
 


* Experience with speech-to-text and transcription systems in production environments.
* Prior work in healthcare tech or regulated environments.
* Deep understanding of clinical workflows, EHR systems, and medical documentation processes.
* Experience with frontend development in JS and React.
* Experience with Windows development in C#.



 Location
 



 We believe the best ideas happen when we’re together. This role is based in our vibrant HQ in the Epicenter building in the heart of Stockholm where you will work primarily from our office to collaborate, connect, and build our culture.
 



 How to Apply
 



 We adopt a continuous selection process, so please make sure to apply with your CV in English.
 



 Our interview process consists of 4 stages:
 


* Screening interview with Talent Acquisition
* Shorter technical interview with one of senior engineers
* Follow up technical interview with some of our Engineering team
* First interview with our CTO & Co-Founder
* Working Day - Join us in the Stockholm office for a day to experience our culture firsthand, collaborate with our team, and see how you work in action.



**Benefits** 



* Competitive salary & company stock options
* 25 days/year of paid vacation
* 5,000 SEK wellness allowance (friskvårdsbidrag)
* Social and team-building activities (off-sites, after works, winter/summer parties)
* An opportunity to make a real positive impact in the world of healthcare
* Work with some of the best minds in AI, healthcare, and engineering.



*We review our benefits packages on a regular basis and might modify our benefits from time to time.* 




**Culture at Tandem** 




 At Tandem, we move fast, think big, and take ownership. We're a high-performing, diverse team with a shared drive to change the future of healthcare - and we’re just getting started.
 



 Our culture is built on action, ambition, and learning. You'll be trusted to take the lead, challenge yourself, and make an impact from day one. We believe real growth happens when you're stretched, supported, and surrounded by smart, passionate teammates who want to win together.
 



 Even though we’re spread across countries, we come together often in Sweden for team meetings, social events, and offsites - blending global reach with real human connection.
 



 We hire for talent, potential, and attitude - valuing different backgrounds and fresh perspectives. Great ideas come from everywhere, and we’re building a team that reflects the world we want to change.

title: Product Marketing Manager
description:
Dedicated to powering entrepreneurs, Qred is a profitable, fast-growing fintech scale-up bank. In just 10 years, we’ve grown from a startup to hitting 1 billion SEK in annual revenue supporting over 50,000 entrepreneurs and helping create 10,000+ jobs every year. We combine smart tech with real-world experience to make funding simple, fast, and fair for entrepreneurs who need it most. With strong backing, a flat organization, and bold growth plans, we’re now looking for a Product Marketing Manager to join us and shape the future of small business owners.
   

  

 This is a unique opportunity to own the product marketing strategy for all of Qred's financial products, with an initial focus on driving demand and growth for our highly successful credit card. You'll work in a fast-paced, non-bureaucratic environment with a flat structure where great ideas are quickly put into action.
   

  

**What You'll Be Doing**
 As the go-to marketing partner for our products, your main goal will be to translate customer insights into effective, revenue-driving campaigns.
   

  

* Strategize & Drive Demand: Gathering market and competitive intelligence will be a key part of developing and owning the product marketing strategy. This strategy will focus on driving demand for Qred's financial products, starting with the credit card, by ensuring our offerings are well-positioned for success.
* Collaborate & Execute: Work closely with our in-house marketing experts, copywriters, and designers to execute campaigns across key channels, including social media, SEM, SEO/LLM, direct mail, and publisher-led campaigns.
* Analyze & Optimize: Track campaign performance, analyze results, and manage budgets to meet ROI targets. You'll use data to spot issues and optimize for conversion and growth.
* Refine Messaging: Provide strategic input to create compelling messaging, ad copy, and creative assets that resonate with our target audience.
* Partner with Teams: Act as the primary marketing partner for our Product Development, partnerships and Customer Success teams.


**Who We're Looking For**
 We're looking for an experienced product marketer who is a true owner, ready to take the reins and make a significant impact from day one.
   

  

* Experience: 3+ years in product marketing, ideally within fintech, financial services, credit cards, or a fast-growing digital company; product cross-selling experience is a plus.
* Demonstrated ability to manage multiple stakeholders and project management.
* Acquisition Expertise: Strong knowledge of key acquisition marketing channels (social media, SEM, SEO/LLM, direct mail, publisher-led campaigns).
* Collaboration: Proven ability to work effectively with in-house experts and creative teams to deliver impactful campaigns.
* Data-Driven: Confident with data, performance metrics, budgeting, and ROI optimization.
* Communication: Excellent communication and stakeholder management skills. Our corporate language is English, but proficiency in any of our markets’ languages is a big plus.
* Hands-on in running campaigns (e.g., direct mail), building dashboards, and supporting with copywriting and translations
* Customer-Centric: Ability to translate customer insights into compelling messaging and creative direction.


**Why Join Qred?**
* Make an Impact: We have a flat structure with delegated responsibilities. Got a cool idea? Good - try it out!
* Grow with Us: The company is growing fast, and our employees grow right along with it. This is the place to develop your skills in a fun, fast-moving environment.
* Be Yourself: We are a very diverse team that learns from each other. We believe you will do amazing things here, no matter who you are.
* Great Location: Our office is located in central Stockholm, and we love to hang out across teams and enjoy each other’s company.


**One last thing**
 This is a full-time, permanent position based in Stockholm. Don’t wait to send in your application, we are reviewing applications on a rolling basis. While the start date is flexible, the right candidate can join us immediately.
   

  

*Qred celebrates diversity and does not discriminate based on ethnicity, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, disability status, or any other applicable characteristics protected by law.*
 Qred is an international FinTech scale-up that specializes in digital financing solutions for small businesses, with operations in the Nordics, Benelux, Germany and Brazil. We are passionate about helping small businesses thrive and grow, by providing them with business loans and credit cards. Right now we’re in an exciting phase of our journey that focuses on growth through smart product development and technology fueled by international expansion.

title: Network and Client Management – UK
description:
***Aurora Live by Management Events** 
 is the premier platform connecting top-tier business leaders with exclusive networking opportunities, cutting-edge insights, and world-class events.
 *Aurora Live Business Network connects over 10.000 decision makers across Northern Europe, DACH, UK and France. The members of the network meet at both physical and virtual interactions which bring them relevant contacts, content, and food for thought for the fast-evolving technology landscape they work within.**
**Are you a relationship builder with a passion for driving growth?** 
 Management Events is seeking Key Client Managers and Network Growth Managers to join our team. You will play a pivotal role in expanding our network of high-level decision-makers. How do these roles contribute to the company's growth?
   

  

 As a
 **Key Client Manager** 
 , you will focus on building and maintaining strong relationships with existing C-suite clients.
   

  

 As a
 **Network Growth Manager** 
 , you will identify and cultivate new relationships with C-suite executives.
 **What will you do?**
* Identify and engage with high-level decision-makers in your target market market
* Initiate contact with C-level Executives by phone and on LinkedIn to excite them about our concept
* Demonstrate the value of our service and convince them to become part of our exclusive business network in personal scheduled videocall meetings
* Build strong, long-term relationships with C-level executives
* Learn more about their interests, investments plans and upcoming projects
* Develop and execute strategies to expand our network and build valuable relationships, by knowing your customers key challenges and focus areas
* Contribute to the overall growth and success of Management Events


**What do we expect?**
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills
* Strong business acumen and a results-oriented mindset
* Ability to thrive in a fast-paced, target-driven environment
* Have a passion for connecting with key industry players and driving business growth
* Proactive approach and eagerness towards connecting with new clients and overcoming challenges
* Ideally experience in a commercial and/or client-facing role (e.g. hospitality, sales, customer service, etc.)
* Fluency in English


**Why Management Events?**
* Possibility to work with a unique business concept and influence your own earning level – commissions and bonuses from both individual contributor and team results
* Thorough training in our international ME Academy and continuous training and self-development opportunities during your employment
* Build your own personal network with (inter)national top decision-makers!
* Hybrid working possibility
* Be part of the culture, where we enjoy spending time together with social events and team-building activities
* Earn up to 12 additional vacation days on top of the annual vacation days
* Well-being benefits such as gym and massage discounts
* See the video: What’s it like to work at ME?


**How is the recruitment process?**
* Screening video call with recruitment
* First interview with hiring manager
* Second interview (including role-play) with team manager


 Send you CV with your application in English!
   

  

**Our Growth Partnership Solutions Include**
**Guaranteed 1-to-1 Executive Meetings**
 Tailored introductions with senior decision-makers, handpicked by our customers to align with their strategic objectives.
   

  

**Exclusive Networking Experiences**
 Curated, invitation-only events that foster meaningful dialogue with key stakeholders and future partners.
   

  

**Brand Positioning & Thought Leadership**
 Opportunities to showcase expertise and influence target audiences through targeted content and speaking engagements.

title: 2026 Graduate Talent Program - Global Markets - Stockholm
company_industry: Banking, Financial Services, and Investment Banking
description:
**Job Reference #**
 326637BR
   

  

**City**
 Stockholm, Sweden
   

  

**Your role**
 Interested in working in financial services, specifically learning about global market trends, and working for a firm with a truly global footprint? We're looking for ambitious students to join our 2026 Global Markets Graduate Talent Program.
   

  

 You’ll get to
   

  

* build and maintain strong relationships with institutional investors (asset managers, hedge funds, pension funds, sovereign wealth funds, etc.)
* distribute equity research, market intelligence, and investment ideas generated by the research and trading desks
* provide timely market updates, sector insights, and investment themes tailored to client portfolios
* collaborate with research analysts, traders, and investment bankers to deliver cross-product solutions
* support equity capital markets (ECM) transactions by marketing IPOs, secondary offerings, and block trades to institutional investors
* monitor market trends, news flow, and macroeconomic developments that may impact equities
* prepare and deliver client presentations, investment roadshows, and corporate access events


**Your team**
 Within Global Markets, you’ll be part of the Global Equity Sales team, where you’ll act as the link between institutional investors and the bank’s equity research, trading, and capital markets capabilities. The role involves developing and maintaining client relationships, providing market insights, and distributing the firm’s equity products to drive revenue and client engagement. You’ll be based in Stockholm, Sweden.
   

  

**Your expertise**
 We’re looking for a candidate who
   

  

* is graduating between 2024 and 2026
* has or is on track for at least a 2.1 (UK grading system) or equivalent in their first undergraduate degree
* is available to start in February
* has an analytical mindset with the ability to interpret market data and research
* has excellent communication, presentation, and relationship management skills
* has a high level of resilience, adaptability, and client focus in a fast-paced environment
* has prior experience in Equity Sales, Trading, Research, Capital Markets or Corporate Finance is highly valued
* has fluency in English required; proficiency in a Nordic language (Swedish, Finnish, Danish or Norwegian) strongly preferred


 We’re looking for someone who’s curious and wants to thrive in a business that never stops moving. We welcome all majors, but it’s important to have an interest in the financial industry. We want to see what makes you unique and discover what you can bring to our team.
   

  

**About Us**
 UBS is the world’s largest and only truly global wealth manager. We operate through four business divisions Global Wealth Management, Personal & Corporate Banking, Asset Management and the Investment Bank. Our global reach and the breadth of our expertise set us apart from our competitors.
   

  

 With our large and diverse team operating internationally, we have a presence in all major financial centers in more than 50 countries. Although we all come from different backgrounds and specializations, two things unite us the conviction that we’re stronger together, and the will and curiosity to constantly improve.
   

  

**Join us**
 At UBS, we know that it's our people, with their diverse skills, experiences and backgrounds, who drive our ongoing success. We’re dedicated to our craft and passionate about putting our people first, with new challenges, a supportive team, opportunities to grow and flexible working options when possible. Our inclusive culture brings out the best in our employees, wherever they are on their career journey. And we use artificial intelligence (AI) to work smarter and more efficiently. We also recognize that great work is never done alone. That’s why collaboration is at the heart of everything we do. Because together, we’re more than ourselves.
   

  

 We’re committed to disability inclusion and if you need reasonable accommodation/adjustments throughout our recruitment process, you can always contact us.
   

  

**Disclaimer / Policy Statements**
 UBS is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We respect and seek to empower each individual and support the diverse cultures, perspectives, skills and experiences within our workforce.

title: Management Consultants for PA Consulting - Stockholm Office
description:
**Company Description**
 PA Consulting in Sweden is growing and looking to expand our teams across multiple capabilities with people that have experience within management consulting. In PA we are working together to offer end-to-end solutions for our clients. As we see an increasing demand for our services, we are looking for new talented consultants to welcome to our teams. If you have previous experience from the consulting field and are motivated to contribute to building our business and delivering great value for our clients, we encourage you to send in an application.
   

  

**Our vision:** 
 Support our clients’ design and build efficient organisations – innovative, integrated, value centric.
   

  

**Our mission:** 
 We are a hybrid of strategy, technology, innovation and transformation consultants who excel in converting complexity into opportunity and in delivering accelerated impact for our clients through our transformative end-to-end approach.
   

  

**Our assets:** 
 Our diverse teams within different capabilities and industries.
   

  

**Some of our expertise;**
* Translating strategy to high level business architecture and IT services design.
* Advising, implementing & delivering innovative transformations.
* Delivering and partnering on digital transformations.
* Transformational sourcing solutions underpinned by deep technical, commercial and procurement understanding.


 Our clients in Sweden are operating in the following industries; Public Services, Energy & Utilities, Consumer & Manufacturing, Financial Services and Transport. If you have experience within any of the industries mentioned, please make sure to highlight so in your application.
   

  

**Job Description**
 We are looking for skilled management consultants – you are a consultant with a well-defined toolbox who is eager to continue and develop and cater to our clients’ needs. As our need is across the business, we are looking for consultants who have experience in both leading and supporting projects. Joining us will help drive your career forward and you will grow alongside your colleagues. You will become a part of a strong professional and global environment that will challenge you and give you the opportunity to develop professional and personal skills. Examples of project experience that would be highly relevant are;
   

  

  

* Strategy development
* New operating models, reorganisation
* Process development and operational excellence
* Digitalization programs and implementation


 Please highlight in your application if there are certain areas where you believe you can add value.
   

  

**Qualifications**
* A minimum of 3-5 years of experience of working as a management consultant is considered a must
* Experienced in leading teams, projects and programs helping clients identifying business needs
* Excellent ability to solve complex problems
* Ability to understand business needs, drive C-level conversation and work with leaders across business and IT
* Ability to lead complex initiatives with use of a range of methodologies
* Structured in communication and implementation of initiatives
* Full proficiency in Scandinavian language


**Meritorious should you have;**
* Held roles such as project leader or program manager


***We welcome international applications, but we are unable to offer sponsorship for work permits, so you will need to have the full right to live and work in Sweden.***
*For more information, please reach out to Sanna Austrell; sanna.austrell@paconsulting.com*
**Additional Information**
**Company Description**
 We believe in the power of ingenuity to build a positive human future. As strategies, technologies and innovation collide, we create opportunity from complexity.Our diverse teams of experts combine innovative thinking and breakthrough use of technologies to progress further, faster. Our clients adapt and transform, and together we achieve enduring results.An innovation and transformation consultancy, we are over 4000 specialists in consumer and manufacturing, defence and security, energy and utilities, financial services, government and public services, health and life sciences, and transport. Our people are strategists, innovators, designers, consultants, digital experts, scientists, engineers and technologists.
   

  

 We operate globally from offices across the UK, US, Netherlands and Nordics.
   

  

**PA. Bringing Ingenuity to Life**
 Life at PA encompasses our peoples’ experience at PA. It’s about how we enrich peoples’ working lives by giving them access to unique people and growth opportunities and purpose led meaningful work.
   

  

 We believe that diversity fuels ingenuity. Diversity of thought brings exciting perspectives; diversity of experience brings a wealth of knowledge, and diversity of skills brings the tools we need. When we bring people together with diverse backgrounds, identities, and minds embracing that difference through an inclusive culture where our people thrive; we unleash the power of diversity – bringing ingenuity to life. We’re committed to recruiting, promoting and rewarding our people solely based on their ability to contribute to PA’s goals, without regard to their sex, race, disability, religion, national origin, ethnicity, sexual orientation, age or marital status.

title: Product Designer (App UI Focus, 12 Month Contract)
description:
10% of Europe's CO₂ emissions are caused by residential heating, and energy bills are out of control. Aira is here to change that.
   

  

 With our intelligent Aira Heat Pump at the heart, we're making the switch to clean energy-tech easier and more affordable. Helping Europe turn off gas and slashing energy costs one home at a time.
   

  

 Founded in 2022, and with 1000+ employees and counting, Aira is driving the clean energy revolution by providing homes with modern clean energy-tech solutions such as solar power, battery storage solutions, and heat pumps. With a state-of-the-art production facility in Poland, an HQ in Stockholm, Sweden, and hubs across the UK, Germany, and Italy, Aira is well on track to install clean energy-tech into 5 million homes by 2034.
   

  

**About The Role**
 We are now looking for a talented mid-level Product Designer to join our team in Stockholm for a substitute period of 9–12 months with a main focus on designing our mobile application, ensuring beautiful, consistent, and highly usable experiences that help customers engage with their energy systems. Our customer-facing app isn’t just another digital product, it directly operates our intelligent Aira Heat Pump, and will soon integrate with solar, EV charging, and battery solutions. This is a unique opportunity to design digital experiences that connect users with real, life-changing energy technology in their homes.
   

  

 In this role, you will:
   

  

  

* Design responsive, user-centered interfaces following UX/UI best practices and accessibility standards.
* Build wireframes, prototypes, and high-fidelity designs that clearly communicate user flows and interactions.
* Contribute to our design system by building scalable components, and style guides that ensure consistency and quality across projects.
* Support and conduct usability and prototype testing, applying insights to improve the customer experience.
* Design and refine both new features and existing app experiences, bringing variety and continuous improvement.
* Collaborate closely with developers to ensure accurate implementation and smooth handoffs.


**What You Bring To The Team**
* 5+ years of professional experience as a Product Designer, with strong focus on UI and app design.
* A portfolio showcasing pixel-perfect, user-centered design work on mobile or web apps.
* Proficiency in Figma and prototyping tools.
* Strong understanding of usability, accessibility, and responsive design.
* Experience in design systems and component management.
* A proactive, collaborative mindset with the ability to adapt quickly.
* Fluency in English (spoken and written).


**Nice to Have:**
* Experience working in agile teams.
* Experience designing complex digital products, with the ability to grasp technical aspects and translate them into intuitive, user-friendly interfaces


**What is in it for you?**
* Gain hands-on experience in a fast-growing scale-up, with a supportive and inclusive culture, and career advancement opportunities.
* Collaborate with diverse teams across international markets and launch products globally.
* Develop and grow personally and professionally in an entrepreneurial-minded environment.
* Thrive in a dynamic, solution-oriented culture, tackling challenges and driving meaningful solutions that make a positive impact on the world.
* Influence the company's success, with a visible impact on product development and market growth.
* Enjoy the flexibility of our hybrid work model and discover our brand-new office at Norra Stationsgatan 93 in Stockholm. Conveniently located near public transport, with Sankt Eriksplan and Odenplan stations just a few minutes' walk away


 At Aira, we champion the next-generation energy as well as diversity and inclusion. We firmly believe that a diverse workforce fosters innovation and creativity, enhancing our ability to serve customers and communities effectively. We welcome individuals from all backgrounds, cultures, and perspectives to join our team. Our commitment is to uphold equality and inclusivity, fostering a collaborative environment where everyone can thrive and contribute to a better future for our people and the planet.

title: Azure Cloud Architect
description:
*Vill du vara med och forma framtidens molnlösningar – och samtidigt sätta din egen prägel på ett växande företag?* 




  





**Om rollen** 




 Som Azure Cloud Architect hos oss kommer du att designa, implementera och underhålla avancerade Azure-lösningar för våra kunder. Du blir en del av ett litet, agilt team där dina idéer och beslut gör verklig skillnad. I rollen får du ett stort ansvar och en central position i att driva Cloudiums utveckling framåt – både tekniskt och strategiskt. Du samarbetar nära kunder och interna team för att skapa lösningar som är både smarta, skalbara och säkra.
 



  





**Vi söker dig som** 




 Har stark teknisk kompetens och entreprenörsanda – du ser möjligheter, tar initiativ och vågar tänka nytt. I ett mindre team trivs du med att ha inflytande och ta ägandeskap över projekt. Som problemlösare hittar du de bästa lösningarna för komplexa utmaningar och navigerar smidigt mellan teknik och kunddialog. För att lyckas i rollen ser vi att du har:
 



  




* Flera års erfarenheter att arbeta med Azure och dess tjänster.
* Praktisk erfarenhet av infrastruktur, scripting, automatisering och/eller utveckling.
* Erfarenhet av att designa och implementera molnlösningar inom stora organisationer.
* Förmåga att arbeta självständigt och driva projekt framåt.



  





**Om Cloudium** 




 Med över 35 års samlad erfarenhet inom IT har vi på Cloudium specialiserat oss på infrastruktur, SQL Server och Azure. Vi förstår de utmaningar företag möter vid övergången till molnet och erbjuder skräddarsydda lösningar som optimerar drift, säkerhet och prestanda. Vårt mål är att leverera exceptionell service och överträffa förväntningar. Med djup expertis och ett kundfokuserat arbetssätt guidar vi dig genom hela processen – från strategi till en effektiv, säker och skalbar molnlösning.
 



  





**Är du vår nästa kollega?** 




 Hos oss får du mer än bara ett jobb – du får en nyckelroll i ett växande företag där dina insatser verkligen gör skillnad. Vi kombinerar teknisk spetskompetens med en innovativ och framåtdrivande kultur där vi vågar testa nytt, utvecklas och ha kul på vägen. Vill du vara med och forma Cloudiums framtid tillsammans med oss?
 



  





**START** 
 : Enligt överenskommelse
 



**PLATS** 
 : Stockholm
 



**OMFATTNING** 
 : Heltid
 



**LÖN** 
 : Enligt överenskommelse
 



**KONTAKT** 
 : Recruiter Jacob Chalkley jacob.chalkley@oddwork.se (för frågor om tjänsten, ej ansökningar)
 



**SISTA ANSÖKNINGSDATUM** 
 : Urval sker löpande
 



  





 This recruitment process is powered by Teamtailor on behalf of Oddwork. By applying for this role, you confirm that we store your personal data to be able to process the job application. Follow the link to read the Privacy Policy and learn more about what type of personal information we collect and how we use and protect such information: jobb.oddwork.se/pages/teamtailor-gdpr

title: Tjänstespecialist
description:
Inera är ett digitaliseringsbolag som bidrar till att utveckla välfärden. Vi är Sveriges digitala ingång till hälsa, vård och omsorg och utvecklar digital infrastruktur för en sammanhållen välfärd. Vi arbetar på uppdrag av kommuner och regioner. Vår vision är världens mest innovativa och omtänksamma välfärd.
 



  





 För att kunna upprätthålla hög kvalitet inom hälsa, vård och omsorg måste välfärden utvecklas, med oförändrade eller minskade resurser. Genom digitalisering – att förändra strukturer, beteenden och arbetssätt med stöd av digital teknik – kan flera av välfärdens utmaningar mötas. Det gör Ineras uppdrag viktigare än någonsin.
 



  





**Om rollen** 




 Som tjänstespecialist ingår du i ett team som ansvarar för förvaltning och utveckling av den nationella tjänsteplattformen - en teknisk plattform som effektiviserar informationsutbytet mellan olika IT-system inom vård och omsorg. Plattformen fungerar som navet mellan system som behöver kommunicera med varandra och möjliggör ett säkert kostnadseffektivt informationsutbyte. Arbetet med tjänsteplattformen handlar i grunden om systemintegration över organisationsgränser.
 



  





 Du är en del av i IT-avdelningen, inom sektionen Samverkansarkitektur och Integrationer. Du arbetar i ett agilt team tillsammans med tjänstespecialister, produktägare och utvecklare för att förvalta och vidareutvecklar tjänsteplattformen. Du har ett nära samarbete med Ineras tjänsteförvaltningar, kundtjänst och kunder.
 



  





 Exempel på arbetsuppgifter:
 


* Utföra tekniska anslutningar till den nationella tjänsteplattformen.
* Felsöka, övervaka och testa tekniska anslutningar med hjälp av verktyg som Kibana, Grafana och SoapUI.
* Hantera ärenden, till exempel incidenthantering och stöd till aktörer i deras tekniska anslutningar.
* Ta fram testsviter och acceptanstester i samarbete med Inera Test och Utveckling för att säkerställa kvalitet och driftsäkerhet.
* Aktivt bidra till att vidareutveckla och effektivisera processer och verktyg.



  





**Är det här du?** 




 Du har relevant utbildning inom IT, exempelvis som systemvetare eller utvecklare. Du har erfarenhet av applikationsförvaltning och gärna arbete med systemintegrationer.
 



  





**Varaktighet och tillträde** 




 Tjänsten är en tillsvidareanställning på heltid. Tillträde enligt överenskommelse. Intervjuer sker löpande och tjänsten kan komma att tillsättas innan ansökningstidens slut.
 



  





**Frågor om rollen?** 




 Lotten Holm, Sektionschef, lotten.holm@inera.se
 



 Fanny Wistrand, Tjänstespecialist, fanny.wistrand@inera.se
 



*Fackliga frågor (Vision), Monica Rosén,* 
 monica.rosen@inera.se

title: Senior Staff Software Engineer
description:
At Optimizely, we're on a mission to help people unlock their digital potential. We do that by reinventing how marketing and product teams work to create and optimize digital experiences across all channels. With Optimizely One, our industry-first operating system for marketers, we offer teams flexibility and choice to build their stack their way with our fully SaaS, fully decoupled, and highly composable solution.
   

  

 We are proud to help more than 10,000 businesses, including H&M, PayPal, Zoom, and Toyota, enrich their customer lifetime value, increase revenue and grow their brands. Our innovation and excellence have earned us numerous recognitions as a leader by industry analysts such as Gartner, Forrester, and IDC, reinforcing our role as a trailblazer in MarTech.
   

  

 At our core, we believe work is about more than just numbers -- it's about the people. Our culture is dynamic and constantly evolving, shaped by every employee, their actions and their stories. With over 1500 Optimizers spread across 12 global locations, our diverse team embodies the "One Optimizely" spirit, emphasizing collaboration and continuous improvement, while fostering a culture where every voice is heard and valued.
   

  

**The Role:**
 We're seeking a skilled Software Engineer to join our Graph team and enhance the search functionality within our multi-tenant service. This role requires significant experience designing, implementing, and maintaining Elasticsearch/OpenSearch in a production environment. You will own projects from initial requirements gathering (PRD) through to successful completion, collaborating with customers to ensure solutions meet their specific needs.
   

  

 As part of our team, you'll contribute to building cutting-edge features leveraging serverless compute, auto-scaling OpenSearch clusters, and LLMs with Machine Learning nodes. We are a team that prioritizes high code quality in every commit.
   

  

**Why is this team critical to Optimizely?**
* Business Impact: Graph is the core content delivery and search service powering the SaaS version of our Content Management System (CMS). Our customers, who rely on Graph for their websites and mobile applications, demand high performance and advanced query capabilities to deliver exceptional user experiences. Graph's reliability and speed directly impact their business success.
* High Visibility & Innovation: Our roadmap prioritizes innovative content delivery and search features, placing search and AI at the forefront of our service offering. This focus differentiates us from competitors and empowers our customers to build cutting-edge web and mobile applications. You'll be instrumental in developing these differentiating features.
* Shape the Future of Digital Experiences: The team plays a critical role in shaping the future of our customers' digital presence. Your contributions will directly influence how they engage their audiences and achieve their business objectives through innovative search and content delivery experiences


**Experience Required:**
* 5+ years’ experience of developing and managing services in production
* Experience managing Elasticsearch / OpenSearch in production, with optimization of settings, shards, and replicas.
* Experience creating optimized Elasticsearch / OpenSearch queries
* Experience developing with TypeScript
* Expertise with API design and development of GraphQL or RESTful web services
* Partnering closely with internal stakeholders to gain a strong understanding of business and product data needs
* You find satisfaction in being a force multiplier for your colleagues
* Bachelor’s or master’s degree in computer science or engineering or related experience require


**Some technologies we work with:**
* Elasticsearch / OpenSearch
* GraphQL, REST
* TypeScript, JavaScript, C#
* Cloudflare workers, Kubernetes


**What sets you apart:**
* Experience developing GraphQL APIs
* Experience in Kubernetes, Docker etc. and/ or serverless cloud stacks
* Experience developing multi-tenant services
* Experience of Machine Learning in Elasticsearch / OpenSearch
* Experience working with go-to-market teams
* Understanding the value of pair programming/TDD/Clean Code
* Exposure/Experience leveraging functional languages / paradigms


 Optimizely is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Optimizely is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other legally protected status.

title: 2026 Off-Cycle Internship - Global Markets - Stockholm
company_industry: Banking, Financial Services, and Investment Banking
description:
**Job Reference #**
 326606BR
   

  

**City**
 Stockholm, Sweden
   

  

**Your role**
 Interested in working in financial services, specifically learning about global market trends, and working for a firm with a truly global footprint? We're looking for ambitious students to join our 2026 Off-cycle Internship Program within our Global Markets business, starting in January or June 2026.
   

  

 You’ll get to
   

  

* distribute equity research, market intelligence, and investment ideas to institutional investors (asset managers, hedge funds, pension funds, sovereign wealth funds, etc.)
* provide timely market updates, sector insights, and investment themes tailored to client portfolios
* monitor market trends, news flow, and macroeconomic developments that may impact equities
* prepare and deliver client presentations, investment roadshows, and corporate access events
* support equity capital markets (ECM) transactions by marketing IPOs, secondary offerings, and block trades to institutional investors


**Your team**
 Within Global Markets, you’ll be part of the Global Equity Sales team, where you’ll act as the link between institutional investors and the bank’s equity research, trading, and capital markets capabilities. The role involves providing market insights and distributing the firm’s equity products. You’ll will be based in Stockholm, Sweden.
   

  

**Your expertise**
 We’re looking for a candidate who
   

  

* is in their penultimate or final year of their degree, or who has recently graduated within six months of starting the internship
* has or is on track for a 2.1 (UK grading system) or equivalent in their first undergraduate degree
* has an analytical mindset with the ability to interpret market data and research
* has high level of resilience, adaptability, and client focus in a fast-paced environment
* is fluent in English required; proficiency in a Nordic language (Swedish, Finnish, Danish or Norwegian) strongly preferred


 We’re looking for someone who’s curious and wants to thrive in a business that never stops moving. We welcome all majors, but it’s important to have an interest in the financial industry. We want to see what makes you unique and discover what you can bring to our team. Perhaps you’ve organized a fundraising event or taken part in team sports? Or stepping out of your comfort zone to learn about a subject you found challenging? Let us know how your achievements match the skills we’re after.
   

  

**About Us**
 UBS is the world’s largest and only truly global wealth manager. We operate through four business divisions Global Wealth Management, Personal & Corporate Banking, Asset Management and the Investment Bank. Our global reach and the breadth of our expertise set us apart from our competitors.
   

  

 With our large and diverse team operating internationally, we have a presence in all major financial centers in more than 50 countries. Although we all come from different backgrounds and specializations, two things unite us the conviction that we’re stronger together, and the will and curiosity to constantly improve.
   

  

**Join us**
 At UBS, we know that it's our people, with their diverse skills, experiences and backgrounds, who drive our ongoing success. We’re dedicated to our craft and passionate about putting our people first, with new challenges, a supportive team, opportunities to grow and flexible working options when possible. Our inclusive culture brings out the best in our employees, wherever they are on their career journey. And we use artificial intelligence (AI) to work smarter and more efficiently. We also recognize that great work is never done alone. That’s why collaboration is at the heart of everything we do. Because together, we’re more than ourselves.
   

  

 We’re committed to disability inclusion and if you need reasonable accommodation/adjustments throughout our recruitment process, you can always contact us.
   

  

**Disclaimer / Policy Statements**
 UBS is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We respect and seek to empower each individual and support the diverse cultures, perspectives, skills and experiences within our workforce.

title: Delivery Project Manager
description:
At Climeon, we strive to make the world a better place by improving the climate and environment with our Heat Power modules that convert low temperature heat into electricity, delivering renewable and green electricity for ships, industrial processes and local communities.
 



  





 Our Delivery team is at the very front of our mission as they are responsible for delivering on our customer promise. Ensuring that our HeatPower products are delivered in line with our customer’s expectations. We are now looking for a Delivery Project Manager to join our team!
 



  





 Being a Delivery Project Manager at Climeon is a versatile role where you will gain widespread knowledge on the technology surrounding our Heat Power modules. You’ll be managing our delivery projects from contract signing to site acceptance testing and customer handover.
