You’ll ensure that all major stakeholders work to deliver on our promise ensuring that technical validation of solution is made, integration design completed, production ordered, production acceptance testing conducted and all planning for commissioning whether it will be on land or at sea is made.
 



  





 Majority of the work is done from Climeon HQ in Kista, Stockholm, but some travel will be part of the job, whether this is during project planning / production phase or whether it’s customer site visits prior to or during commissioning activities.
 



  





**The role includes:** 



* Support pre-contract activities: project scoping and planning to ensure project success and customer profitability.
* Ensure the project is delivered according to customer needs and contract scope.
* Manage resources, timelines, and costs throughout the project.
* Manage customer communication throughout the delivery project.
* Report project status to the customer and internally within Climeon.
* Support the customer with information and documentation needed for site design. If necessary, drive and follow up on design changes in Climeon’s products.
* Lead and participate in start-up and commissioning activities together with the project team.
* Responsible for Factory Acceptance Test (FAT) and Site Acceptance Test (SAT).
* Manage the handover from Delivery to the customer and Climeon Service after project objectives are met.
* Coordinate and follow up on Engineering, Sourcing, and Shipping activities.
* Report issues, findings, and learnings back to the Kista office.
* Lead and be part of the delivery project team; coordinate work within the team, with the customer, and with other departments at Climeon.



  





**Who are you?** 




 This role would suit an applicant motivated by hybrid-role ( Desk/Hands-On) in an international environment. The role requires a high degree of self-motivation and to solve tasks independently as well as in small groups and teams.
 



  





 We believe that the right candidate has a technical academic background and a number of year of experience as a project manager:
 


* University Degree or equivalent in e.g. mechanical engineering or another relevant field.
* 3+ Years of Project Management Experience
* Self-driven, Self-Leadership and team-player are important characteristics. As well as being positive, social and customer oriented.
* Experience in the maritime sector or with ORC technology is meritorious.



  





 As a person we seek someone who enjoys working as a team, helping and supporting others when needed with a strong customer focus. We also believe that the right candidate is responsible, driven, curious, flexible and has good communicative skills.
 



  





**Why Climeon?** 




 You will become a valuable and appreciated member in a workplace where everybody is passionate about contributing to make a difference towards a more sustainable world. You will have the opportunity to be a part of an exciting journey with difficult challenges along incredible opportunities to learn and develop.

title: Sourcing Manager
description:
DeLaval is now looking for a Sourcing Manager within Category Electrical & Motion Control . We are looking for you who have high ambitions and have the guts to make challenging decisions. If you enjoy communicating and negotiate this might be your dream job!
   

  

 DeLaval Sourcing is a team of 60 sourcing professionals located in Europe, Americas and China. Here you get the opportunity to work internationally.
   

  

 You will play a key role in creating long term sourcing strategies within Category Electronics, to define and execute plans to meet the objective of developing the optimal supplier base for DeLaval – today and in future.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* Create and implement strategies for the sub-categories with Electronics.
* Overall responsible for the assigned suppliers.
* Contract management (create, maintain, terminate).
* Deliver on KPI’s like cost savings, contract coverage, payment terms, Quality, Sustainability; overall supplier performance in accordance with our Supplier Score Card.
* Define strategic sourcing opportunities and work with Product owners, Engineering, Factories and Logistics to execute.


**Qualifications And Experience**
 You are a person with great commercial interest and a passion for doing business while staying close to the technology. You are analytical, structured, take own initiatives and with ability to handle multiple things at the same time.
   

  

 You are good at maintaining relationships and like to represent sourcing in cross functional teams as well as towards suppliers in a professional way. You are also self-driven with high integrity and contribute to the development of the team. Within all these areas of competence you have previous experience within strategic sourcing in an international environment.
   

  

 We expect you to have an academic degree or equivalent.
   

  

 As the role involves communication with global suppliers, you are fluent in English, and preferably also in Swedish.
   

  

**Working at DeLaval**
 O ur core values Passion, People, Professionals and Partnerships connect individuals across entities and geographies. Success is far more than knowledge – it is strongly related to behaviours. At DeLaval we are all guided by our three behaviours, Set Direction, Make things happen and One DeLaval.
   

  

 We offer you a workplace like no other, where state-of-the-art technology goes hand in hand with animal welfare. DeLaval is a part of the Tetra Laval Group together with Tetra Pak and Sidel.
   

  

 This is a full-time permanent position based at DeLaval’s headquarters in Tumba, south of Stockholm. Travelling will be part of the position. We offer a hybrid workplace model, allowing flexibility to work remotely.
   

  

 We review applications ongoing. We do not accept applications via email, however if you have any questions regarding the role or the recruitment process don’t hesitate to contact us.
   

  

**For Further Information, Please Contact**
 Stefan Linde Category Director, hiring manager: stefan.linde@delaval.com
   

  

 We look forward to hearing from you!

title: Maximo Techno Functional Consultant / Architect
description:
At Capgemini Engineering, the world leader in engineering services, we bring together a global team of engineers, scientists, and architects to help the world’s most innovative companies unleash their potential. From autonomous cars to life-saving robots, our digital and software technology experts think outside the box as they provide unique R&D and engineering services across all industries. Join us for a career full of opportunities. Where you can make a difference. Where no two days are the same.
   

  

**Your role**
 We’re looking for a Maximo Techno Functional Consultant/ Architect to join our Swedish PLM Team.
   

  

* Design, Plan, Review and Recommend Maximo solution and lead Maximo team for delivery
* Guide all technical aspects of solution development and integration, Industry Recommendation, Performance Improvements, Add-on Tool evaluation
* Responsible for providing Maximo consulting services to the clients
* Execute Maximo requirement discovery workshops and documents requirements gaps
* Lead the Maximo functional design process for the product implementation
* Collaborates with Technical Consultants and Analysts to ensure the deliverables and schedules are achieved
* Liaise/lead with the test team and run the User Acceptance Test
* Create training documents and deliver training
* Actively participate in the Development of business and vendor relationships.
* Actively participate in staff recruitment and retention activities, providing input and guidance into the staffing process.
* Lead business development initiatives to grow the Finance team and Federal practice
* Manage resources and budget on client projects.
* Participate and lead aspects of the proposal development process
* Display both breadth and depth of Knowledge regarding functional and technical issues
* Display leadership and business judgment in anticipating client/project needs and developing alternative solutions
* Provide counselling/coaching, oversight, and support for delivery teams and staff


**Your profile**
* 8+ years of Experience in IBM Maximo with hands on experience on Maximo Application Suite 8/9
* 5+ years of work experience in Sweden
* Experience in MAS Upgrade/Implementation
* Experience in Implementing, Configuring and Customizing Maximo Mobile
* Have hands on Experience with Maximo customization, scripting, configuration, installation and integration


**What We Believe You Will Enjoy About Working Here**
* We recognize the significance of flexible work arrangements to provide support. Be it remote work, or flexible work hours, you will get an environment to maintain healthy work life balance.
* At the heart of our mission is your career growth. Our array of career growth programs and diverse professions are crafted to support you in exploring a world of opportunities.
* We support your personal development and offer an education library with more than 250 000 (!) courses and educations and certifications.


**Application**
 As part of our recruitment process, identity verification or background checks may occasionally be conducted.
   

  

 Capgemini is a global business and technology transformation partner, helping organizations to accelerate their dual transition to a digital and sustainable world, while creating tangible impact for enterprises and society. It is a responsible and diverse group of 340,000 team members in more than 50 countries. With its strong over 55-year heritage, Capgemini is trusted by its clients to unlock the value of technology to address the entire breadth of their business needs. It delivers end-to-end services and solutions leveraging strengths from strategy and design to engineering, all fueled by its market leading capabilities in AI, generative AI, cloud and data, combined with its deep industry expertise and partner ecosystem.

title: Astor Groups subsidiary Airsafe Sweden AB is looking for a development engineer
location: Upplands Väsby och Sollentuna, Stockholm County, Sweden
description:
Do you want to take on a crucial role in a unique environment supporting strength and security to our society?
 




  






 Due to a deteriorating global security situation, Scandinavian Astor Group are increasing our engagement in niches within the defence and security sector. Therefore, we need to strengthen our operations with a new colleague for our subsidiary Airsafe Sweden AB.
 




  





**The role** 





 As Development engineer at Airsafe Sweden you will be developing new products as well as work with product development of the existing portfolio. In the role you will work together with the Technical manager and be involved in the strategic planning and the processes related to our production, as well as collaborate and coordinate with other functions internally or at sub-contractor. It is important that you are a social person as customer contacts will be a natural part of the role.
 




  






 Since we are a small company, with in-house production, this role mostly requires physical presence at our office in Upplands Väsby and you are expected to work office hours. Some travel may be required.
 




  





**Main responsibilities and tasks** 



* Responsible for Research and Development of new possible products as well as for present products within our existing portfolio
* Liaise with present and future customers to meet their need of products and support
* Sales support
* Technical support for our own production
* Quality control of manufactured products to make sure they meet specific standard



  





**Your profile** 





 To thrive in this position, we believe that you are a qualified engineer with a couple of years’ experience from a small or medium-sized enterprise. You are interested in innovation and new business opportunities as well as being an internal support to the production process and work closely with the production team.
 





 You have a good ability to express yourself in both spoken and written Swedish as well as in English.
 




  





**Required qualifications:** 



* B. of Sc., Technical orientation
* Knowledge of ISO standards
* Hands-on experience in a small-sized manufacturing environment
* Good knowledge in technical english
* Swedish citizen
* Drivers licens (B)



  





**Meritorious if You have:** 



* Experience in developing of safety materials
* Previous experience in aviation or aviation safety equipment
* Experience of working with the Swedish defence material administration
* Knowledge in technical sewing



  





**About the company** 





 Airsafe Sweden AB develops, manufactures and does maintenance for parachute systems, aviation safety equipment and technically advanced sewn products for military as well as civil use, both in Sweden and internationally. Airsafe Sweden is a top provider of air safety equipment, offering tailored solutions and comprehensive maintenance services. Based in Upplands Väsby, with a legacy dating back to 1977.
 





 For application or inquiries, please contact Airsafe Sweden AB CEO Gabor Nagy e-mail:
 
 gabor.nagy@airsafe.se, phone:
 
 +46(0)70-6905342

title: PhD student in Psychology (B)
emails: olga.perski@su.se, mats.nilsson@psychology.su.se, st@st.su.se, st@st.su.se, saco@saco.su.se, saco@saco.su.se, seko@seko.su.se, seko@seko.su.se
description:
**The Department of Psychology** 
 is a creative and international workplace for research and education. The Department of Psychology conducts successful research in occupational and organisational psychology, clinical psychology, cognitive psychology, perception and psychophysics, personality, social and developmental psychology, psychobiology and epidemiology.
   

  

 Our researchers publish regularly in international journals and actively participate as experts in the media. We collaborate extensively with external organisations and we have a constant exchange of visiting students and researchers from all over the world. As a researcher with us, you will have access to modern research infrastructure. We have a recording studio, advanced laboratories for sleep- and sensory research, and large databases that enable complex studies over time. We also collaborate with the Stockholm University Brain Imaging Centre, offering state-of-the-art imaging technologies, including MRI, EEG and TMS.
   

  

 For more information about us, please visit the Department of Psychology.
   

  

 Project description
   

  

 The doctoral position is part of the 5-year project “Time Matters: Uncovering dynamic mechanisms and optimising the intervention timing across the addictions”, funded by a 2025 European Research Council Starting Grant. The project is led by Dr Olga Perski as the Principal Investigator (PI). The project combines “ecological momentary assessment” (EMA) with passive sensing via smartphones and smartwatches (e.g., geolocation, heart rate variability) to examine when, where and how to intervene for each person, with a view to better supporting people to quit harmful addictive behaviours. The project will recruit two doctoral students who will contribute to different aspects of the research; PhD employment A) the psychological investigation of dynamic processes and PhD employment B) mathematical modelling and computer simulations.
   

  

 The doctoral student specialising in the mathematical modelling and simulation of dynamic processes will focus on the development of a dynamical systems model of relapse risk in the addictions. The work will also include conducting an intensive, longitudinal study with individuals with hazardous and harmful alcohol consumption, heavy cannabis use, or problem gambling and validation of the dynamical systems model against empirical data.
   

  

 The doctoral student will work closely with the PI, a PhD student specialising in the psychological investigation of dynamic processes, a research assistant, and a postdoctoral researcher. The project is supported by an international advisory board. The project includes opportunities for international conference travel, research visits at other universities, and participation in summer schools.
   

  

 We are looking for a motivated and committed individual with an interest in the mathematical modelling of social and psychological processes (particularly dynamical systems modelling). The candidate should have a high degree of independence but should also demonstrate a collaborative approach to research and be able to work productively within a larger team. Previous experience with mathematical modelling (e.g., agent-based modelling, Markov chains or ordinary differential equations), data science and coding in R, MATLAB or Python is an advantage. As the candidate will be part of an international team, excellent English language skills (written and spoken) is a requirement.
   

  

 Qualification requirements
   

  

 In order to be admitted to postgraduate education, the applicant must have the general and specific entry requirements. The qualification requirements must be met by the deadline for applications.
   

  

 You meet
 **general entry requirements** 
 if you have completed a second-cycle degree (master’s level), or completed courses equivalent to at least 240 higher education credits, of which 60 credits must be in the second cycle, or have otherwise acquired equivalent knowledge in Sweden or elsewhere.
   

  

 You meet
 **specific entry requirements** 
 for doctoral studies in psychology if you have completed courses equivalent to at least 90 credits at undergraduate or graduate level in psychology or another scientific discipline relevant to the dissertation topic, of which at least 15 credits must consist of independent work (thesis/publication), or equivalent knowledge acquired in another way. The applicant must be able to engage with scientific literature written in English.
   

  

 See the General Syllabus for Third-Cycle (Doctoral) Studies in Psychology.
   

  

 Selection
   

  

 In the selection process, consideration will be given to previous academic merits, and an assessment will be made of the applicant’s ability to benefit from the doctoral training programme.
   

  

 The main basis for this assessment is (1) the thesis/publication to be submitted with the application, and (2) other educational and professional qualifications, including previous publications (CV).
   

  

 Please see the Department of Psychology’s website for further information and application instructions.
   

  

 Admission Regulations for Doctoral Studies at Stockholm University.
   

  

**About The Employment**
 We offer a fixed-term employment as a doctoral student according to Chapter 5 of the Higher Education Ordinance (1993:100). The period of employment may not be longer than what corresponds to full-time doctoral education for four years. As a doctoral student, you should primarily devote yourself to your own doctoral education, but the employment may include work with education, research and administration to a limited extent (maximum 20 %).
   

  

 A new employment as a doctoral student is for a maximum of one year, the employment is then renewed for a maximum of two years at a time.
   

  

 Requested starting date: 1 January 2026, or as soon as possible after that.
   

  

 Stockholm University strives to be a workplace free from discrimination and with equal opportunities for all.
   

  

 Contact
   

  

 For more information, please contact the PI, Dr Olga Perski, olga.perski@su.se.
   

  

 General information about the Department of Psychology and the application to the doctoral training programme is provided by the Director of Studies, Mats Nilsson, phone: +46 8 16 4605, mats.nilsson@psychology.su.se.
   

  

 Application
   

  

 Apply for the PhD student position at Stockholm University's recruitment system. Attach a personal letter and CV as well as the attachments requested in the application form. It is the responsibility of the applicant to ensure that the application is complete in accordance with the instructions in the job advertisement, and that it is submitted before the deadline.
   

  

 The instructions for applicants are available at: How to apply for a position.
   

  

 Stockholm University contributes to the development of sustainable democratic society through knowledge, enlightenment and the pursuit of truth.

title: BRX Program Lead - Senior Project Leader
description:
On behalf of Cellcolabs, PharmaRelations is recruiting a highly strategic and experienced
 **Program Lead** 
 (full-time position). This senior leadership role will take full ownership of Cellcolabs’ bioreactor scale-up and facility build-out program (BRX) – one of the company’s most critical and transformative initiatives. The Program Lead will hold end-to-end responsibility for driving execution, bringing together cross-functional teams, and ensuring delivery from concept to implementation. Success in this role requires outstanding project leadership skills, deep technical and operational knowledge of biotech manufacturing, proven experience with bioreactor systems, and the ability to manage complex programs in a dynamic, fast-paced, and entrepreneurial environment.
 



  





**Location:** 
 Cellcolab´s facilities in Solna.
 



  





**About Cellcolabs** 




 Cellcolabs is a pioneering biotech company focused on the development and manufacturing of mesenchymal stem cell-based therapies. Mesenchymal Stem Cells (MSCs) have shown groundbreaking potential to cure and treat a myriad of diseases and ailments. Our mission is to industrialize high-quality cell therapy manufacturing to enable global clinical and commercial use. As part of this journey, we are scaling up a next-generation, bioreactor-based production platform through the
 **BRX program,** 
 covering process development, assay development, lab and facility construction, and GMP readiness.
 



  





 Cellcolabs is based on 20 years of research from Karolinska Institutet and is approved for GMP production of ATMPs by the Swedish Medical Products Agency. We are founded and backed by some of Sweden’s foremost health and life science entrepreneurs as well as Norrsken. Our HQ is in Stockholm, Sweden, with operations and sales across the world.
 








**Your New Job** 




 As BRX Program Lead, you will own the delivery of the full BRX project portfolio, covering all phases from design to implementation. You will provide strategic oversight across multiple concurrent projects, each led by its own project manager, and lead the planning and execution of both the development laboratory and the GMP production facility. Your role will focus on coordinating at the program level—bridging priorities, timelines, and resources across internal and external stakeholders.
 



 This is a hands-on leadership role at the heart of Cellcolabs’ industrialization strategy.
 



 This full-time permanent position reports to the CPO and is based in the office in Stockholm, Sweden, and includes international travelling.
 



  





**Key Responsibilities** 



* Full program ownership of the BRX program, including strategic coordination of projects for process development, potency assay development, facility construction (lab and production) and technology transfer.
* Build and lead multidisciplinary teams of project managers and SMEs across process, QA, QC, regulatory, and facility design.
* Align cross-functional deliverables to internal timelines, GMP compliance, and regulatory milestones.
* Manage budgets, risk, resources, and internal/external stakeholder communication.
* Secure structured reporting to management, grant providers, and project steering groups.








**Requirements** 



* 10+ years of experience in project or program management in biotech, pharmaceutical, or advanced therapy settings.
* Proven leadership in complex, multi-stakeholder build-out and scale-up projects, including GMP facility construction.
* Deep understanding of biotech/ATMP production processes, bioreactors (operational, process etc), GMP compliance, and technology transfer in regulated environments.
* Experience building and leading cross-functional teams, including external partners and consultants.
* Leadership experience is highly valued.
* Strong business judgment, communication skills, and ability to operate strategically and tactically.
* Fluent in English (Swedish is a plus).
* PMP (Project Management Professional) or similar certification is an advantage.



  





  





**What we offer** 




**Growth** 




 Be part of an innovative, collaborative work environment, working with some of the brightest minds in the field and learn and develop every day.
 



**Culture** 




 We live and work by our shared company values: Nothing is Impossible, Growth, Passion, We Win as One, Joy, and Integrity.
 



**Impact** 




 Be part of our mission to disrupt healthcare as we know it through advanced cell therapies and make an impact for real with the vision to create good health for everyone.
 



**Benefits** 




 Take part of an extensive insurance package including specialist health care and wellness allowance.
 








**Recruitment Process - your application** 




  





 PharmaRelations is managing this recruitment on behalf of Cellcolabs. If you believe your background and expertise align with the requirements, we encourage you to submit your application through the “Apply” button. All applications will be reviewed with great care as we seek the right candidate for this role. Please note that application documents should not be sent via email. For questions regarding the position, you are welcome to contact Kristina Edholm (kristina.edholm@pharmarelations.se).

title: Senior Retail Sales Executive - Estée Lauder Companies - Stockholm
description:
**Description**
*Are you an experienced sales executive who is passionate about prestige beauty? Ever looked at a beauty store's shelf and told yourself ""This, I would have done it differently?"" Do you love executing event strategies, setting goals and expanding your network through meeting different retailors?*
 Then this might be the role for you.
   

  

**Estée Lauder Companies at a glance**
 The Estée Lauder Companies Inc. is one of the world’s leading manufacturers, marketers, and sellers of quality skin care, makeup, fragrance, and hair care products. The company’s products are sold in approximately 150 countries and territories under brand names including: Estée Lauder, Aramis, Clinique, Lab Series, Origins, MAC, La Mer, Bobbi Brown, Aveda, Jo Malone London, Bumble and bumble, Darphin Paris, TOM FORD BEAUTY, Smashbox, AERIN Beauty, Le Labo, Editions de Parfums Frédéric Malle, GLAMGLOW, KILIAN PARIS, Too Faced, Dr.Jart+, and the DECIEM family of brands, including The Ordinary and NIOD.
   

  

**The role**
 We are seeking a dynamic and inspirational Senior Retail Sales Executive to lead by example, coach, and develop our retailer's in-store teams. This role is pivotal in driving us towards achieving our sales, customer service, and operational targets. Your passion for people, our company, and our products and services will ensure that both retailer staff and customers have a unique and inspirational in-store experience that educates, inspires, and delights.
   

  

 This exceptional opportunity involves managing several of our top stores within your district. You will be responsible for creating and executing an agile business plan to recruit and retain customers through strategic targeting, impactful in-store events, exceptional customer relationship management, and the training of retailer staff. Your outstanding people skills will help you forge collaborative relationships with in-store teams, ensuring the store meets the Company's high standards of visual merchandising.
   

  

 Additionally, you will manage, develop, and nurture a direct team of Point of Sale staff. You will report to your District Manager.
   

  

 The position is permanent and full-time, based in Stockholm. The potential start date will be 2025.11.15.
   

  

**More Specifically, You Will**
* Reach the retail targets by door and district, by month and by year and track the progression of the targets
* Build and develop collaborative relationships with our retailors
* Align with the different stores manager about the brands' business plans and ensure that the agreed trade plans are executed
* Follow up with the different doors' performance and create an action plan if needed
* Ensure that visual merchandising is optimal and updated in accordance to the brands' guidelines
* Facilitate Master Classes and Events within own district
* Secure one/one service in all sell-out doors and conduct one/one bookings with customers
* Educate generic staff ensuring that they have the right knowledge about our Hero products and deliver authentic and personalised experience during sell-out occasions
* Manage and develop a direct team of Point of Sales staff
* Plan for and handle recruitment and succession


**Qualifications**
**You are the perfect fit if you:**
* Are a passionate and experienced beauty expert preferably in make-up, fragrance and skincare industry
* Have previous experience in retail
* Are business-minded and aligned with KPI's set by the company
* Have a proven track record of meeting and exceeding sales targets and for delivering exception customer experience
* Have excellent communication, organisation and time management skills
* Are proficient in a Swedish and English both in speaking and in writing
* Are able to work retail hours including days, evenings, weekends and special events in a fast-paced work environment
* Have a driver's license
* Are digital savy with Social Media platforms such as TikTok and Instagram


**Your Personality**
* You have a genuine interest about our brand portfolio and carry the different brand identities wherever you go
* You have a warm and welcoming personality which makes you a natural networker
* You bring new ideas to the table which will add value to the success of the team and the different stores
* You are a great communicator and have good social skills
* You believe in team effort and are always willing to help when someone needs an extra hand
* You are not afraid of making mistakes and being part of the solution
* You have an eye for details and like to have things in order. When things do not go as planned, you can quickly adapt to change and work with the resources you have


**What We Offer**
* Working for the Estée Lauder Companies means that you will be part of the global leader's journey in Prestige Beauty
* Competitive salary including a bonus opportunity
* Discounts on part of the company's product portfolio
* Great training and development programs on a professional and personal note and the opportunity to move to other markets
* Want to make a difference at work? We engage our colleagues by contributing to greater causes and giving back to the community through social initiatives


**Inclusion, Diversity & Equity in the core of everything we do**
 Estee Lauder Companies is an equal opportunities employer. We positively encourage applications from suitably qualified and eligible candidates regardless of sex, race, disability, age, sexual orientation, gender reassignment, religion or belief, marital status, or pregnancy and maternity.
   

  

**Next Steps**
 You will have to apply through our Career Portal and we will get in touch with you directly if your profile could be a good fit. The deadline to apply is 2025.10.05.
   

  

 The expected start date will be 2025.11.15.
   

  

 As part of the recruitment process, you will receive a link to complete a video interview stating your motivation for this job.
   

  

 We are looking forward to receiving your application!

title: Postdoctoral studies in Metabolic flux in Type 2 diabetes (scholarship)
description:
**Do you want to contribute to top quality medical research?**
 We are looking for a highly motivated Post-Doctoral candidate interested in understanding the molecular drivers of metabolic dysfunction.
   

  

**Division & Duties**
 The candidate will work on the regulation of insulin sensitivity in skeletal muscle as well as on a whole-body level using several model systems. Projects cover disease mechanisms as well as protocol and assay development.
   

  

 You will join an exciting project headed by Dr. David Rizo Roca, aimed at identification and biological validation of key regulatory metabolic pathways that contribute to changes of insulin resistance in the context of type 2 diabetes. For this project we are looking to recruit a person interested in understanding the role of exercise-responsive metabolites in the regulation of skeletal muscle metabolism, mitochondrial function and insulin sensitivity.
   

  

 Dr Rizo Roca’s team is part of the Section of Integrative Physiology, headed by Professor Juleen R Zierath and Professor Anna Krook, at the Department of Physiology and Pharmacology. The research group is interdisciplinary, with expertise spanning clinical physiology and medicine, cell physiology, exercise physiology, molecular biology, and bioinformatics, all focused on the study of metabolic disease.
   

  

 Read more about the integrative physiology group here.
   

  

**Entry Requirements**
 Postdoctoral scholarships may be established for foreign researchers who pursue their merit in Sweden. A foreign researcher is a person living in another country who comes to Sweden with the intention of only staying in Sweden for all or part of their postdoctoral education at KI. Persons who are resident in Sweden and/or have carried out all or part of their academic education at KI or some other educational institution in Sweden cannot be considered for scholarships. The purpose of scholarships for postdoctoral qualification is to promote internationalization and contribute to research qualification after a doctorate or equivalent.
   

  

 A scholarship for carrying out postdoctoral research can be granted for a maximum of two years within a four-year period following the receipt of a doctoral degree or equivalent.
   

  

 To be eligible for a postdoctoral scholarship, the person must have obtained a doctorate, or a foreign degree deemed to be equivalent to a doctorate. Applicants who have not completed a doctorate at the end of the application period may also apply, provided that all requirements for a completed degree are met before the (intended) start date of the post-doctoral education.
   

  

 We are looking for a candidate with doctoral training in experimental research. Expertise and research experience in the study of cellular metabolism is desired, both
 *in vitro* 
 and
 *in vivo* 
 . FELASA certification or similar, as well as research experience from clinical studies and from analysis of human samples is also valuable. Previous work with cell signalling and bioinformatic analysis of large data sets is an extra merit. The candidate must be fluent in English, have excellent writing skills and be able to take the lead on projects. We are looking for a cooperative candidate who thrives to work with others. The candidate will join an enthusiastic, collaborative, hardworking and dynamic team.
   

  

**What do we offer?**
 A creative and inspiring environment with wide-ranging expertise and interests. Karolinska Institutet is one of the world's leading medical universities. Here, we conduct innovative medical research and provide the largest range of biomedical education in Sweden. At KI, you get to meet researchers working with a wide range of specialisms and methods, giving you ample opportunity to exchange knowledge and experience with the various scientific fields within medicine and health. It is the crossover collaborations, which have pushed KI to where it is today, at the forefront of global research. Several of the people you meet in healthcare are educated at KI. A close relationship with the health care providers is important for creating groundbreaking top quality education and research. Students and employees have free access to our modern gym facilities with trained staff on site.
   

  

**Location: Campus Solna, research building Biomedicum**
**Type of scholarship**
 The amount is tax free and it is set for twelve months at a time, paid out on a six months basis. In exceptional cases, shorter periods may be acceptable.
   

  

 Read the scholarship rules here.
   

  

**Application process**
*An* 
*application* 
*must* 
*contain* 
*the* 
*following* 
*documents* 
*in* 
*English* 
*or* 
*Swedish:*
* A complete curriculum vitae, including date of the thesis defence, title of the thesis, previous academic positions, academic title, current position, academic distinctions, and committee work
* A complete list of publications
* A summary of current work (no more than one page)


 The application is to be submitted on the Varbi recruitment system.
   

  

**Want to make a difference? Join us and contribute to better health for all**
